title: Data Analyst
description: Design, develop and maintain data visualizations and provide support for web applications. Responsible for learning healthcare clinical and business demands, proposing valuable solutions, and working in a client-facing, team based environment. Must possess an understanding of user interface design and computer science fundamentals in database architecture and web programming. S/he will participate on a cross‐functional team, to design, build, test, deploy and maintain complex data tools and web solutions. ROLE RESPONSIBILITIES Meeting with project stakeholders to understand what data solution is needed and how the solution is valuable to Connecticut Children's. Mock-up solutions to propose visualizations and metrics for stakeholders. Provides input on evaluating and selecting appropriate design alternatives which meet requirements. Performs detailed analysis of source systems and source system data and model that data Support and maintenance of existing web applications Interprets written business requirements and technical specification documents Creates and maintains technical design documentation Designs, develops, and test scripts to import data from source systems and test dashboards to meet customer requirements Performs quality coding to business and technical specifications Insure that the server-side visualization processes and web applications continue to run and operate in the most efficient manner Performs visualization software system administration and testing of releases and patches Extracting, transforming and loading data from multiple sources into visualization applications Responsible for demonstrating software to internal users. Designs, develops and maintains server tasks and triggers in accordance with the required update schedule of each visualization object. Coordinates actions among developers, production control, DBA, infrastructure team and project vendor to implement out the ETL scripts and objects. Validates solutions by developing and executing test plans and scenarios including data design and data quality. Extensive interactions with clinical professionals to validate and improve clinical solutions Demonstrates support for the mission, values and goals of the organization through behaviors that are consistent with Connecticut Children's Standards. Performs other duties as required. KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS AND ABILITIES REQUIRED Knowledge of: Data analysis, expression language, set analysis expression, securing data and data modelling Strong SQL queries experience and good understanding of ETL & data warehousing Statistics background to propose effective metrics and aggregations Web programming and software development Skills: Critical thinking - the ability to suggest creative solutions Analytical approach for providing solutions - be able to break down work into achievable and valuable deliverables Good verbal and written communication skills Requirements: Bachelor's College degree in Computer Science (BS or MS preferred) or equivalent training and enterprise experience required. Desired, but will provide orientation: High-level familiarity with the healthcare industry and terminology Proficiency in Tableau and/or QlikSense Proficiency in using version control / code repository solutions, Git, GitHub Understanding of object oriented programming and model-view-controller design pattern Proficiency developing in PHP, PERL, SQL, Visual Studio .NET. Experience with the Laravel Framework Tailwind and/or Bootstrap CSS libraries jQuery CSS preprocessors SASS/SCSS Build/bundle tools such as Webpack, Mix, and PostCSS Package management - composer, npm, yarn High Reliability Organization concepts and practices Lean Process Improvement Manage Effective Meetings - create meeting goals, agendas, keep time, action items and minutes Ability To: Design, build, test and debug visualization apps based on requirements Build data models and UI interfaces/ Dashboards. Adapt to rapidly evolving business needs and competing priorities Interact at all levels Surface opportunities and issues for process improvement and propose solutions

title: Developer

title: Software Engineer

Familiarity with data analysis/visualization tools (Python, Minitab, Tableau, QLIK) a plus. title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Castleton Commodities International is hiring a Front Office Software Developer to join our Front Office Information Technology team. The ideal candidate will have demonstrated a passion for solving business problems with technology and possess strong programming experience. This position is a hands-on role responsible for developing, supporting, and maintaining a firmwide investment, trading, and analytics platform supported by APIs, applications, and visualization tools. This is an excellent opportunity for candidates with a strong technical background to interface directly with CCI’s commercial personnel. It is also a terrific opportunity to be involved in the early stages of the firm’s shift toward more cloud-first development. Responsibilities: Work directly with Commercial Trading teams to reengineer & optimize trading processes and models. Develop cloud-native solutions to promote integration within the framework of a Firmwide Front Office IT platform including the use of analytical and visualization tools. Partner with Data Science team to create next-generation analytic tools including machine-learning driven platforms and code sets. Develop software to support commercial activity including supply & demand, positions, and market data analysis. Qualifications: Bachelor’s or higher degree in Computer Science or related field of study. 7+ years of prior professional programming experience (is preferred). Advanced Python or Java experience. Advanced understanding of object-oriented programming concepts. Working knowledge working with cloud-based technologies (AWS). Working knowledge in Un*x and Windows environments. Intermediate or higher knowledge of SQL technologies. Ability to communicate and interact with a wide range of users ranging from very technical to non-technical. Results-oriented team player, with the ability to handle a rapidly changing set of projects and priorities while maintaining a strong professional presence. Strong analytical skillset with demonstrated attention to detail. The candidate should be passionate about technology, staying current with trends. Fast learner with the ability to adapt quickly and work in a dynamic environment. Excellent time management skills. Desired Experience: Snowflake, Oracle, SQL Server, or PostgreSQL experience. Experience with DevOps practices, including CI/CD, and infrastructure-as-code. Experience with the following technologies: Git, Containers (Docker), Kubernetes, Microservices, Spring, shell scripting, messaging busses, React, Angular. Experience in MATLAB Employee Programs & Benefits: CCI offers competitive benefits and programs to support our employees, their families and local communities. These include: Competitive comprehensive medical, dental, retirement and life insurance benefits Employee assistance & wellness programs Parental and family leave policies CCI in the Community: Each office has a Charity Committee and as a part of this program employees are allocated 2 days annually to volunteer at the selected charities. Charitable contribution match program Tuition assistance & reimbursement Quarterly Innovation & Collaboration Awards Employee discount program, including access to fitness facilities Competitive paid time off Continued learning opportunities Visit https://www.cci.com/careers/life-at-cci/# to learn more! #LI-CD1

title: Full Stack Developer
description: Cobalt is currently seeking talented individuals eager to join our growing organization. Working in a B2B environment, you will be responsible for developing & supporting our proprietary web-based applications for our clients- a complex SaaS, ERP and CRM systems in the Retail Beverage Industry. This is a full-time work in office. This not a remote position. You must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident. This includes both verbal and written communication Break down complex client requirements into scalable and performant solutions Provide troubleshooting and debug support for existing codebases and applications Implement web or mobile interfaces using PHP, XHTML, CSS, and JavaScript Collaborating with our PM and design teams to define feature specifications and build the next generation of products leveraging framework Work closely with operations and infrastructure to build and scale back-end services Build report interfaces and data feeds Ensuring responsiveness of applications Creating servers and databases for proper functionality Document and write tests for code Track time spent on projects effectively Basic Qualifications: HS Diploma/GED or Higher education preferred 5+ years of experience with OOP in any language Full stack web/mobile application development with a variety of languages including but not limited to: latest versions of PHP, JavaScript, CSS3, and HTML5 4+ Years experience & proficiency in backend framework: Laravel 4+ Years Experience in the following: Relational databases; SQL building/managing & more importantly SQL Query optimization Strong understanding of front-end technologies, including JavaScript, JSX, CSS3, and HTML5 Clear communication and comprehension skills Ability to manage multiple tasks simultaneously Experience using source/version control such as Git Experience with Linux web server configuration Ability to learn new technologies quickly Excellent written and verbal communication skills Works well within AGILE project management methodology Engineering Preferred Qualifications: B.S. Computer Science or related technical field Proficiency & experience in Angular Compensation for roles at Cobalt varies depending on a wide array of factors including but not limited to the role, skill set, and level of experience. As required by local law, Cobalt provides a reasonable hourly range of compensation for roles that may be hired in Connecticut as set forth below and information on benefits offered is here. This is an exciting opportunity for a skilled Full Stack Developer to join our team. We offer competitive salaries, a comprehensive benefits package, and opportunities for professional growth. If you are passionate about software development and want to work on cutting-edge projects in a collaborative environment, we would love to hear from you. Apply now! Note: This is a full-time work in office. This not a remote position. You must be a U.S. citizen or permanent resident. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $68,000.00 - $99,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Health savings account Paid time off Schedule: 8 hour shift Monday to Friday Overtime Weekends as needed Supplemental pay types: Bonus opportunities Ability to commute/relocate: Rocky Hill, CT: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Application Question(s): Do you currently live in Connecticut? Experience: REST: 3 years (Required) JavaScript: 4 years (Required) PHP: 4 years (Required) React: 4 years (Required) SQL: 3 years (Required) Laravel: 4 years (Required) Front-end development: 5 years (Required) Back-end development: 5 years (Required) Work Location: In person

title: Data Scientist
description: Financial Compliance Data Scientist Controller - Internal Controls and Compliance 84635BR University Job Title Data Scientist 1 Bargaining Unit None - Not included in the union (Yale Union Group) Time Type Full time Duration Type Regular Compensation Grade Administration & Operations Compensation Grade Profile Manager; Program Leader (24) Wage Ranges Click here to see our Wage Ranges Searchable Job Family Financial Total # of hours to be worked: 37.5 Work Week Standard (M-F equal number of hours per day) Work Location Central Campus Worksite Address 150 Munson Street New Haven, CT 06511 Work Model Hybrid Position Focus: Reporting to the Senior Financial Compliance Analyst, Analytics, this position will play a pivotal role in transforming raw data into actionable insights that drive informed decision-making and optimize our business strategies. This will include monitoring activity, both through the use of established dashboards as well as through less structured data mining, to identify outliers, trends or other anomalies and perform procedures to investigate such findings. This position will also design, develop and implement advanced analytical models, algorithms and visualizations to uncover key insights, trends, and patterns within the data. This role will conduct additional ad-hoc data analysis, including extracting/consolidating data, to mitigate risks and identify potential compliance issues. This role will also collaborate with management and various University stakeholders to provide insights that support the central monitoring program. This position may perform other special projects as required. Essential Duties Develop and execute new and/or highly complex algorithms and statistical predictive models and determine analytical approaches and modeling techniques to evaluate potential future outcomes. Establish analytical rigor and statistical methods to analyze large amount of data, using advanced statistical techniques and mathematical analyses. Manage analytical projects from data exploration, model building, performance evaluation, through implementation. Develop work plans and monitor progress and project timelines. Document coding and changes to work plans using established work group methods in GitHub. Interact with a multidisciplinary team of internal and external peers to regularly, effectively, and openly communicate progress and outcomes of planned work. Attend weekly team meetings to discuss team and project-related activities, issues, change, communications, and updates. Required Education and Experience Master’s Degree in computer science, applied/computational mathematics, engineering, biostatistics, statistics, or a quantitative field such as astronomy or geology, economics, health policy, health services research, public policy, or a related field and two years of experience or an equivalent combination of education and experience. Required Skill/Ability 1: Exceptional technical software skills using tools such as PowerBI, Advanced Excel (pivot tables, vlookups, macros, index match, data mining) and experience with algorithms and machine learning. Ability to work with large structured and unstructured datasets. Required Skill/Ability 2: Very strong analytical skills to identify trends or outliers. Well-developed problem-solving skills, an intellectual curiosity and inquisitive mindset. Required Skill/Ability 3: Excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to adapt communication style to address the needs of individuals at all levels throughout the University. Required Skill/Ability 4: Strong organizational skills and attention to detail. Required Skill/Ability 5: Ability to work independently, multitask, use good judgment. Preferred Education, Experience and Skills: Bachelor’s degree in Data Analytics, Statistics, Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Four or more years of experience in financial data management and analysis, or equivalent combination of education and experience. Experience with data collection and in coordinating efforts of multiple groups. Drug Screen No Health Screening No Background Check Requirements All candidates for employment will be subject to pre-employment background screening for this position, which may include motor vehicle, DOT certification, drug testing and credit checks based on the position description and job requirements. All offers are contingent upon the successful completion of the background check. For additional information on the background check requirements and process visit "Learn about background checks" under the Applicant Support Resources section of Careers on the It's Your Yale website. COVID-19 Vaccine Requirement The University maintains policies pertaining to COVID-19. All faculty, staff, students, and trainees are required to comply with these policies, which may be found here: https://covid19.yale.edu/health-guidelines Posting Disclaimer The intent of this job description is to provide a representative summary of the essential functions that will be required of the position and should not be construed as a declaration of specific duties and responsibilities of the particular position. Employees will be assigned specific job-related duties through their hiring departments. EEO Statement: University policy is committed to affirmative action under law in employment of women, minority group members, individuals with disabilities, and protected veterans. Additionally, in accordance with Yale’s Policy Against Discrimination and Harassment, and as delineated by federal and Connecticut law, Yale does not discriminate in admissions, educational programs, or employment against any individual on account of that individual’s sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, race, color, national or ethnic origin, religion, age, disability, status as a special disabled veteran, veteran of the Vietnam era or other covered veteran. Inquiries concerning Yale’s Policy Against Discrimination and Harassment may be referred to the Office of Institutional Equity and Accessibility (OIEA). Note Yale University is a tobacco-free campus

title: Software Engineer
description: United States - Connecticut Information Technology (IT) Group Functions Job Reference # 283322BR City Stamford Job Type Full Time Your role Are you an innovative thinker? title: Front End Developer
description: Join Eversource's Dynamic Team as a Senior Front End Software Engineer! Are you a passionate and skilled Front End Software Engineer ready to shape the digital landscape of Eversource? We're on the lookout for an exceptional talent to join our Application Development & Support team in vibrant Berlin, CT. As a Senior Front End Software Engineer, you'll play a pivotal role in driving innovation, designing captivating user experiences, and bringing our web applications to life. What You'll Do: Unleash Your Creative Genius: Transform static design concepts into mesmerizing responsive templates and assets that captivate users across both desktop and mobile platforms. Craft Digital Masterpieces: Design, code, and maintain engaging website content, including eye-catching homepages, compelling landing pages, and visually stunning category banners that leave a lasting impression. Problem Solver Extraordinaire: Take the lead in troubleshooting front-end functionalities, ensuring seamless and glitch-free user interactions that keep our digital realm running smoothly. ️ Tech Wizardry: Harness your mastery of HTML, CSS, JavaScript, and jQuery, weaving together captivating web experiences that leave users wanting more. Elevate User Experience: Collaborate with cutting-edge UI design tools such as Figma to create visually stunning and user-friendly interfaces that redefine what it means to navigate a website. Responsive Design Virtuoso: Champion best practices for responsive design, making certain that our applications shine across a variety of devices and screen sizes. Tech Trailblazing: Stay ahead of the curve by researching and introducing the latest and greatest technologies, ensuring our web applications remain at the forefront of innovation. ️ Communication Maven: Seamlessly translate complex technical concepts into easily digestible insights, fostering effective communication between tech and non-tech teams. Qualifications That Set You Apart: Educational Rockstar: A Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline forms the foundation of your expertise. Web Whisperer: You boast 5+ years of hands-on software development experience in enterprise web cloud applications, with a remarkable 3+ years dedicated to crafting brilliance with React JS. Design Virtuoso: Your artistic flair shines through with hands-on experience in UI design tools like Figma, enabling you to create digital wonders that delight users. ️ Code Conjurer: HTML5/CSS, JavaScript, jQuery, Bootstrap – these are your building blocks for crafting interactive web marvels. Library Luminary: You're well-versed in Storybook, Carbon, and ADA, using them to orchestrate captivating and accessible web experiences. TypeScript Trailblazer: Your prowess in TypeScript propels our applications to new heights of maintainability and innovation. React Revolutionist: Your expertise with React, Next.js, and Node.js transforms ideas into reality, crafting web applications that make a lasting impact. Accessibility Advocate: Building inclusive web experiences is second nature to you, ensuring every user can access and appreciate our creations. DevOps Dynamo: Your experience with CI/CD and DevOps tools (Kubernetes, Docker, Jenkins, Git, etc.) empowers you to lead projects that ride the wave of continuous improvement. Tech Pioneer: Your curiosity drives you to explore emerging technologies, keeping our team on the cutting edge of innovation. Attention to Detail: You're meticulous in accessibility testing, ensuring every pixel is in its rightful place. Agile Aficionado: The agile methodology is your playground, enabling you to thrive in a fast-paced, collaborative environment. ADA & SEO Enthusiast: You weave ADA compliance and SEO best practices into the fabric of everything you create, ensuring our applications shine on every front. ️ Communication Maestro: Your excellent communication skills bridge the gap between technical complexities and non-technical stakeholders, making you a standout collaborator. Ready to embark on an exhilarating journey that blends creativity, innovation, and technical prowess? Join Eversource and shape the digital future today! Compensation and Benefits Eversource offers a competitive total rewards program. The annual salary range for this position is $116,780.00 to $129,750.00, plus incentive. Salary is commensurate with your experience. Check out the career site for an overview of our benefits Working Conditions: Must be available to work emergency restoration assignment as required. Must be available to travel between MA/CT/NH as necessary. #corpajd Worker Type: Regular Number of Openings: 1 EEO Statement Eversource Energy is an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to age, race, color, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, religion, disability status, or protected veteran status. VEVRRA Federal Contractor Emergency Response: Responding to emergency situations to meet customers’ needs is part of every employee’s role. If employed, you will be given an Emergency Restoration assignment. This means you may be called to assist during an emergency outside of your normal responsibilities, work hours and location.

title: IT Support
description: IT Support Specialist Position Summary This is specialized work in the IT Department involving the technical support of computer hardware, software, networks, and other related technologies, Town-wide. The IT Support Specialist will provide/assist in the planning, acquisition, implementation, optimization, training and support of all computer related equipment including desktop and laptop computers, terminals, printers, scanners, modems, Wi-Fi equipment, networking equipment, fax machines, mobile devices, audio visual equipment software and other technologies. This position requires a keen understanding of the technological and operational needs of the Town to analyze, identify and resolve network systems problems and failures. This work requires that the employee have extensive knowledge of computer hardware, software, networks, and operating systems. The IT Support Specialist must research, recommend, and implement ways that technology can improve operational efficiency and organizational productivity. The IT Support Specialist will work under the general supervision of the IT Manager. Examples of Work Implement and maintain up-to-date security technologies as well as research and recommend other state of the art technologies to the IT Manager, Department Heads and Town staff. Provides/assists in the acquisition, implementation, training and support of all network and computer related hardware and software systems and supplies. Actively monitor the status of the network infrastructures performance, availability, and security. Set up and maintain network accounts ensuring proper security, assess and permission levels are established. Provides/assists in the installation and management of pc-based, mobile based and network-based computer hardware and software. Provides support to end users through troubleshooting and maintenance of computer equipment. Takes corrective action as necessary. Plan for and implement technology upgrades as well as migration from existing systems to newer technologies. Maintains an accurate inventory of computer related hardware and software. Assists in updating and maintaining the Town’s social media applications and local government access channels. Acts as a liaison between Town employees and Application, Software, and Hardware vendors. Essential Functions Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Deploy and maintain network equipment, including wifi access points, switches, routers, and firewalls. Responsible for the maintenance, configuration and reliable operation of computer systems, network servers and virtualization. Install and upgrade computer components and software, manage virtual servers and integrate automation processes. Troubleshoot hardware and software errors by running diagnostics, documenting problems and resolutions, prioritizing problems and assessing impact of issues. Provide documentation and technical specifications to IT staff for planning and implementing new or upgrades of IT infrastructure. Perform regular backup operations and implement appropriate processes for data protection, disaster recovery and failover procedures. Lead desktop and helpdesk support efforts, making sure all desktop applications, workstations and related equipment problems are resolved in a timely manner with limited disruptions. Other tasks as required by IT Manager. Competencies Technical capacity Communication proficiency Problem solving / analysis Decision making Initiative Results driven Experience and Education Must possess or be studying for an associate or bachelor's degree in computer science, information technology, system administration, or a closely related field, or equivalent experience, required Experience in municipal government or public safety a plus IT Certifications and/or Experience in IT Support Skills Ability to work autonomously with needed support from IT Manager Desktop and laptop PC setup and maintenance Network cabling Printer setup and maintenance Network services, such as DNS and DHCP Computer troubleshooting Microsoft Office and Windows operating system Video conferencing and telephones Application support Working with external vendors Trouble ticketing process Work Authorization Authorized to work in the United States without sponsorship is required. Must be able to pass a background check by North Haven Police Department Work Environment The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate. Occasional work outside of normal working hours. On call rotation for emergencies. Job duties are performed on site, in an office, and between campus buildings. Occasional travel to offsite locations. Physical Demands The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 50 pounds. Other Duties This job description is not designed to cover a comprehensive listing of activities, duties or responsibilities that are required of the employee for this job. Activities, duties or responsibilities may change at any time with or without notice. Salary $75,566 Send completed employment application, cover letter, and resume to: employment@northhaven-ct.gov North Haven Employment Application and Application Process: https://www.northhaven-ct.gov/government/employment_opportunities.php Closing date: 11/16/23 Job Type: Full-time Pay: From $75,566.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Health insurance Health savings account Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Work Location: In person

title: Field Applications Manager
description: Bring your heart to CVS Health. Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver. Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable. Position Summary In support of the Aetna Student Health IT team, daily job duties would include: Configuration and Administration of IBM WebSphere Application Server ND v8.0/8.5.5 , IBM HTTP Server v8.0/8.5.5, IBM WebSphere MQ v7.1/9.0, WebSphere ODM v8.x and Apache Web Server v2.2 on IBM i series V7R1/V7R2/V7R3 and Windows 2016 Server. Monitoring of CPU utilization, Heap Usage of JVM’s, DB locks for the application performance issues on a daily basis in PROD. Tuning the DB connection pools, Heap size, thread connection as per the recommendation from IBM for performance tuning. Create Queue managers, queues, channels and listeners for WebSphere MQ messaging. Configuration of CXT and Repricer Queue Connection factories and CXT/Repricer request and response queues for messaging between WebSphere Application server and WebSphere MQ. Installation and configuration of IBM WODM , WDS (WebSphere Decision Server) for integration of ILOG RES with GIAS to execute the business rule logic. Involved in performance testing of EDI batch load using Summary and Batch Profiler. Configure IBM i DCM (Digital Certificate Manager ) for SSL certificates signed by Public CA certificates and Local CA certificates on an annual basis Configure SSL for IBM HTTP Server and WAS, created and mapped the Application ID to the corresponding certificates to secure the application environment. Configuration of CXT and LCI (Late Claim Interest) web service across multiple environments by exporting and converting the private key .p12 to. jks using IBM Keytool and import the cert into application library files and configure service end point URL’s in spring configuration files for a successful web service call. Working on CXT and Repricer connectivity issues with Data Power, CXT and Repricer teams. Resolve them within SLA. Enable trace to determine SSL protocol versions & Cipher suites used by System SSL and configure WebSphere MQ channels and WAS to use TLS 1.2 specified cipher suites. Upload the 837 EDI claim files into GIAS PROD on daily basis to auto adjudicate the claims such as dental, medical and hospital and after completion of each EDI batch job verify and send the reports to appropriate Claims team. Troubleshooting on issues such as high utilization of Java Heap , out of memory, memory leaks, MQ connection timeout issues, DB locks, Certificate chain errors for SSL handshake , Certificate path validation and DB SQL errors. Creation and configuration of SID based x509 certs for the authentication of GIAS call to CXT (ClaimsXten) 5.2/6.1.1.1 webservice using openssl . Validate the CXT connectivity issues via SOAP UI for Data power and backend CXT. Configuration and upgradation of TLS 1.0 to TLS 1.2 for WAS, MQ and WODM. Deployment of ODM rule sets and DB2i SQL scripts execution as part of code migration from TST2 to PPE and then to Production. Create Java Core and Heap Dumps during the JVM crash. Deployment of enterprise JAVA/J2EE Applications (.EAR files), Emergency patch fix for the defects to TST2, PPE and PROD environments and providing 24/7 on-call production support when necessary . Create technical documentation for the project and place in SharePoint site. Closely working with Application vendor and IBM on problem determination and resolution for the issues related to the Applications. Required Qualifications 5+ years of application development experience, including the following technologies: IBM WebSphere, IBM i DCM, WebSphere ODM, CXT Preferred Qualifications 5+ years of experience in the healthcare industry Education Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or related field Master's degree preferred Pay Range The typical pay range for this role is: $94,500.00 - $196,000.00 This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. This position is eligible for a CVS Health bonus, commission or short-term incentive program in addition to the base pay range listed above. In addition to your compensation, enjoy the rewards of an organization that puts our heart into caring for our colleagues and our communities. The Company offers a full range of medical, dental, and vision benefits. Eligible employees may enroll in the Company’s 401(k) retirement savings plan, and an Employee Stock Purchase Plan is also available for eligible employees. The Company provides a fully-paid term life insurance plan to eligible employees, and short-term and long term disability benefits. CVS Health also offers numerous well-being programs, education assistance, free development courses, a CVS store discount, and discount programs with participating partners. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies. For more detailed information on available benefits, please visit jobs.CVSHealth.com/benefits CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated. You are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status or apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 10 days of your employment. Please note that in some states and roles, you may be required to provide proof of full vaccination or an approved reasonable accommodation before you can begin to actively work. title: Developer
description: Start your career with a proven industry leader and put yourself on the path to motivated success. RMI provides accounting software to businesses worldwide. RMI is seeking applicants to join our dynamic team of professionals. Join our diverse workforce and begin a challenging and rewarding career. Submit your resume today or submit a job application and take the first steps towards a promising career with RMI. Developer Definition: The Developer role will design and code the features and customizations required for the RMI ADVANTAGE product and our customers. Responsibilities: Code features or customizations using Microsoft C/SIDE language into the RMI ADVANTAGE software for product or our customers Troubleshoot and remedy any system bugs Work with the Client Services Team to troubleshoot customer issues Assist Product Team to implement and test new features Upgrade existing customer databases to the latest versions of RMI ADVANTAGE as they become available Advise other team members and other departments on implementations of new features or customizations Use other technologies such as Mobile Devices, Web Portal and SQL reporting, to integrate with RMI ADVANTAGE for the benefit of the product or our customers Establish and maintain strong collaborative working relationships within the team and other departments Must maintain active and current version Microsoft Dynamics NAV certifications Requirements: Able to learn and adapt quickly to new technologies Excellent organizational, time-management & prioritization skills Able to interact effectively and positively with all organizational levels Self-directed individual with attention to detail Professional demeanor at all times Experience with Excel, Outlook, Access, Visual Studio, SQL Reporting Studio helpful, experience with MS Dynamics NAV is a plus Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or related experience Benefits Employee Benefits Include: Employer matching 401K plan Unlimited paid time off Employer-sponsored health insurance Flexible spending account program Life insurance Paid major holidays More About RMI Corporation: RMI is located in Avon, CT Minutes from downtown Hartford, West-Hartford center and more In business since 1983 Training and certification programs Young, energetic environment Travel opportunities available For more information or to submit your resume email employment@rmiusa.com

title: Application Consultant
description: About Us Intact delivers perfect-fit software solutions that elevate the businesses of our customers. Powered by our customer-focused, collaborative and innovative team of Intacters, our software is used by more than 2,500 businesses worldwide. Continuously innovating since 1992, our open and trusting environment has created lasting relationships. Intact's founders and many of our first team members are still a core part of the organisation. Intacters drive our culture and success and our goal is to inspire, support and help them to develop – and enjoy – their careers. Intact was honoured in the Deloitte Fast 50 for the fourth year running in 2020. To stay future-focused, we are always looking for dynamic team players who are customer-focused and share our enthusiasm for technology. If this sounds like you, then come elevate your career at Intact. Scope of Role The rewarding career you are looking for is at Intact Software. If you love working with technology and like the variety of supporting customers and troubleshooting technical scenarios this might be the job for you. You will be supporting a range of Accounting, Stock, CRM, E-Commerce, Business Intelligence and Supply Chain Management modules within the Intact ERP Software solution and you will be a key member of this evolving team. Working as part of the wider Customer Success Office (CSO), our mission is to provide the Support and Services required to allow customers meet their ambitions for their ERP software. Responsibilities The Application Support Consultant will be responsible for assisting our growing customer base with technical and operational queries across a wide range of business processes. Consultants often have the more complex tickets to work through and therefore require time to focus on getting these tickets resolved without the interruptions incoming calls or Freshdesk tickets requiring quick responses. You will support other team members with guidance on tickets and how to investigate, feeding back information on tickets that have been escalated to them in a form of upskilling. Team members will have the experience to contribute Knowledgebase articles to the Content Hub and get involved in the larger Go Live Handovers. They may also be dedicated contacts for some of our Enterprise customers. Skills and Abilities A person that has some of the following skills and abilities would be at a distinct advantage: A systematic approach to problem solving with strong analytical skills with a “can do” attitude. Must demonstrate initiative, with the ability to work independently or as part of a team. Excellent communication skills and a friendly empathetic manner. Ability to work under pressure and manage customer experience. Strong written and verbal communication skills with the ability to translate business requirements into technical information. Preferred Qualifications and Experience A person applying for this role must have: a day to day working knowledge of Accounting, ERP or Business Management Software systems OR a Degree or third level qualification in Computer Science, Accounting or Business. OR a good knowledge of financial and management reporting & a financial acumen. Experience in any of the following is desirable but not essential as training will be provided: Strong knowledge of Databases, like SQL Server, MySQL including SQL scripting & SQL Admin Studio. Working knowledge of FTP/SFTP, SSL Certs, REST API, SOAP, SoapUI, Postman, Excel, and CSV files. Experience in relevant business software – 3rdParty Integrations, EDI, Logistics, Warehouse Management, CRM, E-Commerce, Business Intelligence. Day to day working with Accounting, ERP or Business Management Software. A good knowledge of financial and management reporting or financial acumen. Benefits Options: Our perfect fit ethos extends to our Intacters, ensuring that our roles, environment, benefits and progression paths are geared toward their professional and personal development. In addition to a competitive salary, we offer a great range of benefits including: Healthcare: Medical, Dental and Vision with Intact Covering the employee only premium amount Short & Long Term Disability AD&D Insurance 401K Plan Employee Assistance Program Intact Wellness Reimbursement: Whether it's a gym or a golf club membership, we support the efforts of Intacters to keep active. PTO: 20 days Per annum New Year’s Day, Martin Luther King, Jr. Day, Memorial Day, Juneteenth Independence Day, Labor Day, Thanksgiving Day, Christmas Day plus two floating holidays Flexibility: Our flexible working helps Intacters to manage a better work-life balance. It is the policy of Intact to promote equal employment opportunities. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, color, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Digital Strategist
description: Linde Inc. HR Digital Strategist Danbury (CT) Tonawanda (NY) United States | req14642 What you will enjoy doing* In this role you will serve as a vital link between business goals and the capabilities of technology to reduce administrative overhead by digitalizing processes You will be the liaison between Linde’s Corporate HR functions, the Information Technology (IT) team and various software providers, and will evaluate and implement emerging HR technologies for process improvement and automation Work with the HR organization to continually improve the effectiveness of processes and procedures, map business requirements to technology capabilities to digitalize existing business processes to reduce costs and improve quality, and optimize the UKGPro & UKG Kronos systems to meet the needs of the Payroll, Benefits, and Workforce Services teams and system users You will be the Subject Matter Expert in multiple Benefit plan provider software solutions and benefit administration systems, and will troubleshoot the Payroll & Benefits processes, administration system, and employee or dependent data issues You will quickly and creatively resolve complex data, process, and system issues impacting employees, and ensure the Payroll & Benefits Administration system is built according to specific requirements, including the seamless integration of external benefit plan providers and the payroll & Benefits system Lead Payroll & Benefits application development projects and upgrades and manage the implementation and testing of files and interfaces You will develop training resources such as webinars to help stakeholders understand how processes work and are executed What makes you great Bachelor’s degree in Human Resources, Business Administration, Computer Science, or another relevant field of education is required 5-7 years payroll and/or benefits services experience, business process engineering, HR system development, system implementation and integrations experience, as well as exposure to AI and Digitalization tools and concepts including Robotic Process Automation and Virtual Agents is required Ability to identify, model, and evaluate technical solutions to transform business goals into application and operational requirements, and ability to coordinate and complete multiple tasks simultaneously and deliver responses within established timeframes You must demonstrate judgment and discretion when dealing with sensitive and confidential information You should have expertise in the following systems: UKGPro Payroll & Benefits, both Back-End and WebPayroll, Advanced Microsoft Office skills including Excel Functional understanding of Kronos WFC, Accruals, and ATK, and experience with Cognigy, Zendesk, Adobe, and MS SQL Project management skills to maintain project timelines and deadlines without supervision, and the ability to apply Information Security and Privacy standards to ensure the confidentiality of HR and PII data Strong customer service and polished communication skills, superior mathematical ability, accuracy, and exceptional attention to detail, sense of urgency, ability to work well under pressure and meet deadlines Why you will love working with us Linde is a leading global industrial gases and engineering company, operating in more than 100 countries worldwide. We live our mission of making our world more productive every day by providing high-quality solutions, technologies and services which are making our customers more successful and helping to sustain and protect our planet. The company serves a variety of end markets including chemicals & energy, food & beverage, electronics, healthcare, manufacturing, metals and mining. Linde's industrial gases are used in countless applications, from life-saving oxygen for hospitals to high-purity & specialty gases for electronics manufacturing, hydrogen for clean fuels and much more. Linde also delivers state-of-the-art gas processing solutions to support customer expansion, efficiency improvements and emissions reductions. Linde employees learn and abide the Linde Code of Ethics and Code of Conduct by demonstrating honesty, integrity, professionalism in all communications, actions, and decisions. What we offer you! At Linde, the sky is not the limit. If you’re looking to build a career where your work reaches beyond your job description and betters the people with whom you work, the communities we serve, and the world in which we all live, at Linde, your opportunities are limitless. Be Linde. Be Limitless. Every day is an opportunity: an opportunity to learn, to grow, to share success, and to contribute to one of the world’s leading industrial gas and engineering companies. Seize the opportunity: take your next step with us and join our team. In addition to competitive compensation we offer a wide range of medical options to suit everyone’s needs. Other benefits include; educational and professional development, employee discount program, 401K, pension plan, and life insurance, just to name a few. The salary range for this role is: $69,000 - $95,000. Have we inspired you? Let´s talk about it We are looking forward to receiving your complete application. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, protected veteran status, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, or any other reason prohibited by applicable law. Linde Inc. acts responsibly towards its shareholders, business partners, employees, society and the environment in every one of its business areas, regions and locations across the globe. The company is committed to technologies and products that unite the goals of customer value and sustainable development. )The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by employees assigned to this classification. They are not intended to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties and skills required of employees assigned to this position. Therefore employees assigned may be required to perform additional job tasks required by the manager.

title: Software Engineer
description: You are a driven and motivated problem solver ready to pursue meaningful work. You strive to make an impact every day & not only at work, but in your personal life and community too. If that sounds like you, then you've landed in the right place. Join an exciting and inclusive work environment where your work matters, and experience firsthand how our Technology, Data, Analytics and Cyber teams enable The Hartford’s customers and employees to succeed. Develop critical functional skills in areas directly related to your role, such as software engineering, application development, cyber security, and more. Associates in the Tech Catalyst program learn technologies and Agile methodologies specific to their roles at The Hartford through immersive training. The multi-week learning experience builds skillsets needed to participate in the entire software development lifecycle process and to position you to grow with emerging technologies and processes. You’ll also have opportunities to network with other teammates, mentors, and leaders at The Hartford. This role is a hybrid position located in Hartford, CT or Charlotte, NC. Candidates must be authorized to work in the US without company sponsorship. What’s in it for you? Gain practical skills as members of the team guide, mentor and coach you to learn the job Receive facilitated and self-directed training relative to your role and The Hartford’s best practices Partner with people in the organization to build a working knowledge of The Hartford’s business, processes, and our customers Learn and use tools to support organizational strategy and business functions Solve a range of core business and technical needs through work on user stories and projects Gain practical skills while you participate in immersive instructor led and/or self-directed training relative to software engineering technologies and The Hartford’s best practices Learn and use industry leading tools to develop software programs that support organizational decision making via prototyping, discovery, etc. Utilize programming languages and software technology, fully understanding and applying disciplined software development processes Develop or modify software application modules using disciplined software development processes Overall knowledge You must be a team player with a positive ‘can do’ attitude and possess the following qualities: Interest in problem solving and role-specific technologies Excellent communication, analytical, interpersonal, and organization skills Time management skills with the ability to adjust to changing priorities in a fast-paced environment Entrepreneurial mindset Demonstration of a strong willingness to learn Responsibilities Participate in immersive instructor led and/or self-directed training relative to software engineering and The Hartford’s best practices Partner with various parts of the organization to build a working knowledge of the organization, business, processes, and its customers Learn and utilize tools such Angular, React, Java and .NET and cloud technologies to develop assets that support organizational goals Engage in work that is guided by more senior members of the team Qualifications Undergraduates expecting to graduate in May 2024 with a bachelor’s degree and a GPA of 3.0 or higher Desired majors include, but are not limited to: Computer Science, Engineering, IT, Management Information Systems, Applied Mathematics Provide evidence of previous knowledge in languages like CSS, HTML, JavaScript, Java, SQL, .NET or Python Possess the technical, analytical and communication skills to solve problems, create technical solutions and tell the story about how your work enables the business to address our customer needs Compensation The listed annualized base pay range is primarily based on analysis of similar positions in the external market. Actual base pay could vary and may be above or below the listed range based on factors including but not limited to performance, proficiency and demonstration of competencies required for the role. The base pay is just one component of The Hartford’s total compensation package for employees. Other rewards may include short-term or annual bonuses, long-term incentives, and on-the-spot recognition. The annualized base pay range for this role is: $59,360 - $89,040 Equal Opportunity Employer/Females/Minorities/Veterans/Disability/Sexual Orientation/Gender Identity or Expression/Religion/Age

title: Call Center Representative
description: Bring your heart to CVS Health Every one of us at CVS Health shares a single, clear purpose: Bringing our heart to every moment of your health. This purpose guides our commitment to deliver enhanced human-centric health care for a rapidly changing world. Anchored in our brand — with heart at its center — our purpose sends a personal message that how we deliver our services is just as important as what we deliver. Our Heart At Work Behaviors™ support this purpose. We want everyone who works at CVS Health to feel empowered by the role they play in transforming our culture and accelerating our ability to innovate and deliver solutions to make health care more personal, convenient and affordable. The role of a Distinguished Call Center Engineer is responsible for leading the development and design of the Call Center Infrastructure strategy for the ETS Organization. This key technical position is accountable for defining architecture and engineering standards, documentation best practices, system monitoring and analytics and top tier (level 4) operational support. This position will also mentor staff members in an effort to develop excellent enterprise telephony skills. Responsibilities include: 1. Designs and implements highly resilient and failure proof call center solutions with the ability to withstand system failures, faulty code and other infrastructure impairments ΓÇô thinks with a global mindset and 'never fail' mentality when implementing solutions. 2. Working across all business disciplines, this senior technical leader will ensure that requirements (both business and technical) and use cases are collected with requirements defined to meet expectations in the most efficient and economical way possible. 3. Conceptualizes, designs, validates and tests complex global contact center architectures that support voice and call center solutions 4. The Distinguished Call Center Engineer will operate at the enterprise level responsible for creating a wholistic strategy and tactical execution plan of implementation, as well as operationalizing investments which ultimately result in a resilient call center architecture that is scalable to meet the growing business needs as well as lowered mean time to repair and time between incidents.The successful candidate will have a strong work ethic, be a self-starter, and able to be highly productive in a dynamic, collaborative environment. The ideal candidate will have the following experience / knowledge / ability: Ability to work Hybrid Model (in office Tuesday / Wednesday / Thursday). 15+ years of enterprise contact center design and architecture experience ΓÇô applicant must be 'hands on keyboard' with the ability to technically explain solution concepts and intangibles. 5+ years of experience within a fortune 50 corporations supporting complex networks with absolute fault tolerance in mind. 5+ years engineering experience in large complex contact center solutions with vendor solutions from large vendors such as Cisco, Avaya, and Five9 Advanced Degree 5-8 years of experience leading diverse project teams Progressive track record leading change through a rapid period of transformation Ability to make quick decisions through a combination of analysis, experience, and judgment A builder of talent who can empower and motivate teams Effective operation in matrix environments to develop alignment and maximize collaboration in a successful manner Excellent critical thinking, verbal, and written communication skills. Ability to communicate with senior levels of the organization Continuous learner well informed on technology trends and methodologies. Leadership skills to include bringing new ideas, insights, and knowledge, and helps drive the organization to implement new programs and solutions Bachelor's Degree - Computer Science, Engineering Pay Range The typical pay range for this role is: $170,000.00 - $325,000.00 This pay range represents the base hourly rate or base annual full-time salary for all positions in the job grade within which this position falls. The actual base salary offer will depend on a variety of factors including experience, education, geography and other relevant factors. As for time off, Company employees enjoy Paid Time Off (“PTO”) or vacation pay, as well as paid holidays throughout the calendar year. Number of paid holidays, sick time and other time off are provided consistent with relevant state law and Company policies. For more detailed information on available benefits, please visit jobs.CVSHealth.com/benefits CVS Health requires certain colleagues to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19 (including any booster shots if required), where allowable under the law, unless they are approved for a reasonable accommodation based on disability, medical condition, religious belief, or other legally recognized reasons that prevents them from being vaccinated. You are required to have received at least one COVID-19 shot prior to your first day of employment and to provide proof of your vaccination status or apply for a reasonable accommodation within the first 10 days of your employment. title: Disability Specialist
description: As the second-largest independent Catholic university in New England, and one of the fastest-growing private doctoral institutions in the U.S., Sacred Heart University is a national leader in shaping higher education for the 21st century. SHU offers nearly 90 undergraduate, graduate, doctoral and certificate programs on its Fairfield, Conn., campus. Sacred Heart also has a campus in Dingle, Ireland, and offers online programs. More than 10,000 students attend the University’s nine colleges and schools: Arts & Sciences; Communication, Media & the Arts; Social Work; Computer Science & Engineering; Health Professions; the Isabelle Farrington College of Education & Human Development; the Jack Welch College of Business & Technology; the Dr. Susan L. Davis, R.N., & Richard J. Henley College of Nursing; and St. Vincent’s College. Sacred Heart stands out from other Catholic institutions as it was established and led by laity. The contemporary Catholic university is rooted in the rich Catholic intellectual tradition and the liberal arts, and at the same time cultivates students to be forward thinkers who enact change—in their own lives, professions and in their communities. The Princeton Review includes SHU in its Best 388 Colleges–2023 Edition, and Best Business Schools–2023 Edition. Sacred Heart is home to the award-winning, NPR-affiliated radio station, WSHU, a Division I athletics program and an impressive performing arts program that includes choir, band, dance and theatre. www.sacredheart.edu Position Summary In this 10-month position, you will empower students with documented disabilities with various academic tools and strategies so that they may develop as self-directed, lifelong learners. A significant objective is assisting students to become aware of their unique strengths and weaknesses, finding ways to make the most of the accommodations provided, and meeting academic standards. Providing quality assurance for the special services includes review of learning and other disabilities documentation, identification of appropriate accommodations, and knowledge of learning strategies and other compensatory techniques in compliance with ADA guidelines. Research and carry out student-focused initiatives. Principal Duties & Responsibilities Administrative Workflow Reviews documentation of student disabilities arriving at appropriate and reasonable accommodations. Coordinates and provides services to students with physical, learning or other disabilities in the relevant academic areas and makes referrals to appropriate University resources to help students attain their academic goals. Demonstrates knowledge of suitable assistive technology tools and identifies reasonable tools that will accommodate learning challenges and assist students to grow as independent learners. Assist in the development of procedures and/or policy documents for disability-related services. Trains and/or consults with faculty to improve understanding about the special services issues and collaborates with faculty in providing useful tools to work with students. Serves as an academic coach to students, coordinates and provides overall quality assurance and troubleshooting support for all Academic Success Coaching. Plans, schedules, coordinates, and designs new student skill workshops. Answers and returns phone calls, emails and other correspondence from parents, professors, students and other SHU departments. Record Keeping & Assessment Reports Maintains records and all data related to supplemental academic support programs, academic coaching program and other OSA programs. Manages the support programs assessment process as part of our continuous improvement initiatives to study and appropriately improve academic success and retention. Oversees the compilation and analysis of data. Maintains and archives documents required for student records and manages student files for monitoring and referral purposes by adhering to confidentiality principles. Contributes to periodic OSA reports, executive summaries, surveys, and other evaluative documents. Utilizes Student Tracking software, OSA data systems and other software to retrieve student data. Assists in managing requests for current and former students for standardized testing, parking, housing, and other specific inquiries. Other Looks to learn and develop professional skills. Understands the strength of working collaboratively with a team and communicating openly. Demonstrates a friendly, approachable, student-focused approach. Knowledge & Skills Needed Master’s degree in Disabilities Services in Higher Education, Special Education, Counseling, Psychology, or related field. Experience working in Higher Education for 1-3 years preferred. Knowledge of student development theories and practices as well as current disability issues and laws. Ability to interpret diagnostic test results and reports from external professionals for LD, ADHD, TBI, visual impairment, hearing impairment, psychiatric disorders, physical disabilities etc. Ability to effectively problem solve, think critically, and communicate effectively with college students and staff in situations of shared responsibility and confidentially. Strong interpersonal skills and sensitivity to diverse cultural, disability and other characteristics of college students is essential. Must be able to work independently and within a team environment and demonstrate excellent oral and written communication skills. Ability to effectively supervise, mentor, and evaluate undergraduate student staff. Proficiency with software and student management/course management systems. Unsual Working Conditions Student focused work environment. May require evening hours and/or weekend hours. Sacred Heart University is a space that respects and embraces differences, recognizes the unique contributions that individuals can make, and creates a community that maximizes the potential of all faculty and staff. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from qualified candidates who reflect the wider world in which we live.
