title: Data Scientist
description: About The Chefs' Warehouse The Chefs' Warehouse, Inc. (http://www.chefswarehouse.com) combines exceptional quality and brand building with broadline food service distribution for more than 35 years. With Protein, Specialty, Produce, and Broadline offerings, we service the most discerning chefs in a hybrid approach of convenience and superior quality. We introduce more than 2,000 artisan producers of the world’s finest ingredients from over 40 countries to the finest chefs in the world. We passionately consult, sell, and build relationships with more than 35,000 customers through the most experienced network of over 600 consultive sales associates, best-in-breed technology, rapid service, and support levels that solidify our long-standing ties to both established and up-and-coming premium restaurants. Mission: The mission of The Chefs’ Warehouse is to provide the world’s greatest ingredients to the world’s best chefs. Our C.H.E.F.S. Values: Curious & Creative Hungry For Food & Results Entrepreneurial Forward Thinking & Flexible Supportive (Of Peers & Chefs) Position Summary: We are looking for an experienced Data Scientist to join our team. A successful candidate will be responsible for quickly analyzing and interpreting data to help drive business decisions and will apply machine learning techniques to provide recommendations for improving our rapidly growing e-commerce platform. What you’ll do: Interface with shareholders to understand the needs of the business and communicate insights to shareholders in a clear and concise manner. Build predictive models to investigate problems, detect patterns and recommend solutions. Own the flow of data from start to finish and provide recommendations to improve the company’s understanding and organization of data. About you: 3+ years of experience working as a Data Analyst or Data Scientist, preferably in an e-commerce or related industry and Bachelor’s Degree in a related field such as Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science. Strong knowledge of machine learning techniques and proficiency in Python, SQL, and other relevant programming languages. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work independently or as part of a team Strong communication skills and the ability to explain complex data concepts to non-technical stakeholders. Bachelor’s Degree and/or Master’s Degree in a quantitative field such as Statistics, Mathematics, or Computer Science. Knowledge of machine learning techniques and their application to e-commerce use cases, including the ability to explain why a specific model was chosen and underlying math behind a model. Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker Studio and/or Plotly. #LI-ND1 The above job description is not an all-inclusive list of duties and standards of the position. Incumbents will follow any other instructions, and perform any other related duties as assigned by their supervisor. Perks & Benefits: Paid Vacations, Paid Holidays Health, Dental and Medical Benefits Weekly pay Life Insurance 5% above cost for our high-quality food products Employee discounts for travel and events 401k The Chefs' Warehouse is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate based on actual or perceived race, creed, color, religion, alienage or national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, disability or handicap, sex, marital status, veteran status, sexual orientation, pregnancy, gender identity or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state, or local laws. We also consider qualified applicants with criminal histories, consistent with applicable federal, state and local law. Our management team is dedicated to this policy with respect to recruitment, hiring, placement, promotion, transfer, training, compensation, benefits, employee activities and general treatment during employment. We are dedicated to building an inclusive and diverse workforce.

title: Telecommunications Engineer
description: At Bristol Health, we begin each day caring today for your tomorrow. We have been an integral part of our community for the past 100 years. We are dedicated to providing the best possible care and service to our patients, residents and families. We are committed to provide compassionate, quality care at all times and to uphold our values of Communication, Accountability, Respect and Empathy (C.A.R.E.). We are Magnet ® and received the 2020 Press Ganey Leading Innovator award for our rapid adoption and implementation of healthcare solutions during the COVID-19 pandemic. Use your expertise, compassion, and kindness to transform the patient experience. Make a difference. Make Bristol Hospital and Health Care your choice. Job Summary: In this unique role you will support both our end user desktop environment as well as our existing VoIP phone system. The right candidate for this position will have the knowledge and experience to work on Windows desktops/laptops troubleshoot printers of all types, nursing mobile carts, conference room systems, etc. and will work closely with all members and levels of the IT department. Troubleshoot VoIP phone issues. This is a dynamic position that touches a lot of our patient and clinical facing systems and hardware. You will be working directly with Doctors, Nurses and patient care staff. You will interact with all hospital staff. Most work will be done independently. The person will also troubleshoot problem areas (in person, by telephone, or via email) in a timely and accurate fashion, and provide end-user assistance where required. Essential Job Functions and Responsibilities: Solid understanding of Windows 10 in a domain environment. Windows laptop and desktop troubleshooting and resolution Work independently and have the ability to escalate issues when needed Write technical documents and share knowledge with staff Perform onsite analysis, diagnosis, and resolution of complex desktop problems for end users, and recommend and implement corrective solutions, including offsite repair for remote users as needed. Install, configure, test, maintain, monitor, and troubleshoot end-user workstations and related hardware and software in order to deliver required desktop service levels. Experience with VoIP phones and troubleshooting Experience with Cisco Call Manager. Adds, moves and changes. The ability to build a call flow based on user and or business requirements. VoIP network troubleshooting using tools such as Variphy, wire-shark etc. Experience with CAT5/CAT6 cable troubleshooting and design Collaborate with network Engineers to ensure efficient operation of the company's network, server and desktop environment. Includes virtual and wireless environments. Where required, administer and resolve issues with associated end-user workstation networking software products. Receive and respond to incoming calls and/or e-mails regarding desktop problems. Familiarity with a modern ticketing and or service management system Answer to and perform moves, adds, and changes (MAC) requests for both desktop issues as well as VoIP issues Basic Cisco switch configuration. Familiarity with Cisco ios command line. Accurately document instances of desktop equipment or component failure, repair, installation, and removal. If necessary, liaise with third-party support and PC equipment vendors. Assisting vendors and healthcare providers to install, maintain and troubleshoot the Healthcare related equipment. Develop and maintain an overall IT asset management system for tracking and maintaining inventory. Assist in the setup and troubleshooting of smartphones as well as handheld mobile units and peripheral scanning devices. Good communication and organizational skills needed as well as exceptional customer service skills Participate in a rotating on-call schedule for after hours VoIP support Minimum Requirements/Experience: Must have minimum of 3+ years experience in a similar role supporting ends and remote workers. Minimum of 2 years experience installing and supporting VoIP phone system is a plus. Must have a technical/vocational school diploma in Computer Science or relatable field. Associate's degree or higher in Computer Science or relatable field is preferred. Comptia A+ (Preferred) Comptia Network+ (Preferred) Google Certified Technician is a plus Cisco CCNA (Preferred) Special Requirements: Experience with Cisco Callmanager and Imagicle contact center software is preferred. Physical Requirements: Sitting, standing, stooping, reaching, bending throughout the work day. Keyboarding, use of hands (fine and gross motor skills). Work Environment: Office settings. May have to work in small spaces to run cable/wiring. Cognitive Requirements: Analytical problem solving, multitasking, maintaining focus, processing written/verbal instructions. Disclaimer The above statements are intended to describe the general nature and level of work being performed by people assigned to this classification. They are not to be construed as an exhaustive list of all responsibilities, duties, and skills required of personnel so classified. All personnel may be required to perform duties outside of their normal responsibilities from time to time, as needed.

title: Full Stack Developer
company: Konica Minolta Business Solutions, U.S.A., Inc.
description: Overview: The Senior Full Stack Web Developer position is responsible for maintaining, enhancing, and growing applications developed by Konica Minolta's Solutions Engineering Center (SEC). Qualified candidates should have experience working with the latest versions of JavaScript (ES2015+) and AWS services such as Lambda, S3, and DynamoDB. In addition to a strong technical background, the ideal candidate should show the ability to think critically, gather information, and problem solve in a team environment. Responsibilities: Perform coding, debugging, testing and troubleshooting throughout the application development process Work with other members of a small to mid-sized development team to design software architecture Assist with set up and tear down of tests for QA Create technical specifications for new features Analyze, diagnose, and implement fixes for reported issues Design and implement new APIs Perform code reviews and mentor other team members Qualifications: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science, Computer Information Systems, Computer Engineering, Mathematics, Engineering, or other related field 5+ years of proven professional experience as a software engineer developing desktop and web based applications Intermediate experience in functional programming, data structures, algorithms and object-oriented design and analysis Intermediate experience in software design best practices Intermediate experience developing software applications using any two or more of the following programing languages / technologies: C#, C/C++, Python, PHP, Node.js, ASP.NET Core, WPF, Go, Rust Intermediate experience developing web applications using modern JavaScript frameworks like React, Angular, HTML5, and CSS3 Intermediate experience using SQL, including stored procedures, functions, triggers, views, constraints, and optimization techniques Intermediate experience using one Cloud Provider (AWS, Azure, GCP) Intermediate experience developing and deploying Docker containers Intermediate experience using Git or similar distributed version control systems Proficient using Linux/Unix from a terminal Strong written and verbal communication skills Self-motivating and self-learning Preferred Personal or professional experience using hapi, serverless.com, ECS, EKS, and Terraform Open source code you are proud of Per Connecticut law, the range for this position is between $92,300 and $153,800 About Us: About Konica Minolta Konica Minolta’s journey started 150 years ago, with a vision to see and do things differently. We innovate for the good of society and the world. The same purpose that kept us moving then, keeps us moving now. Konica Minolta Business Solutions U.S.A., Inc. is reshaping and revolutionizing the workplace to achieve true connectivity through the Intelligent Connected Workplace. The company guides and supports its clients’ digital transformation through its expansive office technology portfolio, including IT Services (All Covered), intelligent information management, managed print services and industrial and commercial print solutions. Konica Minolta has been included on CRN’s MSP 500 list nine times and The World Technology Awards named the company a finalist in the IT Software category. Konica Minolta has been recognized as the #1 Brand for Customer Loyalty in the MFP Office Copier Market by Brand Keys for sixteen consecutive years, and is proud to be ranked on the Forbes 2021 America’s Best-in-State employers list. The company received Keypoint Intelligence’s BLI 2021 A3 Line of The Year Award and BLI 2021-2023 Most Color Consistent A3 Brand Award for its bizhub i-Series. Konica Minolta, Inc. has been named to the Dow Jones Sustainability World Index for nine consecutive years and has spent six years on the Global 100 Most Sustainable Corporations in the World list. Konica Minolta partners with its clients to give shape to ideas and works to bring value to our society. For more information, please visit us online and follow Konica Minolta on Facebook, YouTube, LinkedIn and Twitter. EOE Statement: Konica Minolta is an equal opportunity and affirmative action employer. We consider all qualified applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, sex, pregnancy, age, sexual orientation, transgender status, gender identity, disability, alienage or citizenship status, marital status or partnership status, genetic information, veteran status or any other characteristic protected under applicable law.

title: .NET Developer
description: Do you enjoy working independently and thrive with solving problems while working on multiple tasks at any given time? If you seek the opportunity to work with facts and data, as well as with a prioritized checklist, in your everyday life, then you’ve come to the right place! If you have a methodical work approach, enjoy work that requires focus to improve operational efficiencies, and would like to use your gift of patience – then keep reading. You’re going to love it at SCS Direct. The self-disciplined resident expert we are seeking knows all about being deliberate in their work and how to be innovative and strategic. They also understand the value of being independent and driven, while also being analytical and efficient. The Senior C# Developer - E-commerce recognizes the importance of getting the job done; they are a headstrong perfectionist who thrives with alone time. SCS Direct Inc., started as a niche marketing company focused on a single category. After more than two decades, SCS Direct has evolved into a robust consumer products powerhouse that develops best of breed products across the Toy, Baby, Housewares, Home Improvement, and Outdoor Living categories. Our innovative line of unique products is purchased and enjoyed by consumers not only in the United States but across the globe. SCS Direct Inc. is looking for an experienced Senior C# Developer with a minimum of 5 years of hands-on experience in the E-commerce domain. The ideal candidate will be responsible for designing, developing, and maintaining our E-commerce platform while collaborating closely with cross-functional teams to deliver high-quality, scalable, and performant solutions. As a Senior C# Developer, you will have the opportunity to influence architectural decisions, mentor junior developers, and drive the technical direction of our E-commerce initiatives. Key Responsibilities: Collaborate with product managers, UX designers, and other developers to gather and refine requirements, and translate them into technical specifications and actionable development tasks. Design, develop, and maintain C# codebase for various components of the E-commerce platform, including backend services, APIs, and integrations with third-party systems. Ensure the quality, performance, and reliability of the software through unit testing, integration testing, and code reviews. Participate in architectural discussions and contribute to the evolution of the platform's technical roadmap. Identify opportunities to optimize and enhance the existing codebase, making recommendations for improvements and implementing solutions. Troubleshoot and resolve complex technical issues, working closely with support teams to provide timely resolutions. Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies to propose innovative solutions that enhance the platform's capabilities. Mentor and guide junior developers, fostering a collaborative and knowledge-sharing environment. Qualifications and Skills: Amazon API experience required Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field (or equivalent practical experience). Minimum of 5 years of professional experience in software development using C# within the E-commerce domain. Strong understanding of E-commerce concepts, including catalog management, shopping carts, checkout processes, and payment gateways. Proficiency in ASP.NET MVC and Web API development. Experience with front-end technologies such as HTML5, CSS3, JavaScript, and modern JavaScript frameworks (e.g., React, Angular, Vue.js). Solid knowledge of database design and SQL, with experience working with relational databases (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL). Familiarity with cloud platforms (e.g., Azure, AWS) and their services related to E-commerce applications. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to debug and optimize code for performance and scalability. Excellent communication skills and the ability to work effectively in a collaborative team environment. Prior experience mentoring or leading junior developers is a plus. Job Type: Full-time Pay: $110,000.00 per year Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Health savings account Paid time off Ability to commute/relocate: Trumbull, CT 06611: Reliably commute or planning to relocate before starting work (Required) Work Location: In person

title: Senior Business Analyst
description: BlueCrest is a global, innovative leader in enterprise print, mail and customer communications. Our products include printers, inserters, sorters and parcel solutions—and a renewed commitment to innovative software and vote-by-mail solutions. We are proud to be an industry and market leader in the mail space. Although our manufacturing headquarters is based in Danbury, Connecticut, we are a global company with clients and team members in over 15 countries worldwide, including an expansive field service team comprised of over eight-hundred specialized field service technicians. Advancing our clients' operations to meet the demands of the future takes a great team and hard work. We move quickly to creatively solve problems and implement change. Most of all we cherish our role as a trusted and innovative technology partner. We provide a supportive and inclusive working environment for employees where individuals can thrive, and teams can flourish. Our BlueCrest culture is reflected by our core behaviors: Innovation, Collaboration, Accountability, Resourcefulness and Enthusiasm (I CARE). It is with these behaviors in mind that we approach every customer, every idea, every product, and every employee, every day. It is the essence of how we interact and work—it's how things get done at BlueCrest. BlueCrest is seeking to hire an Sr Microsoft dynamics 365 F&O Business Analyst to build out the Business Analysis team to support the business and IT organizations. The Business Analysis team will perform key roles for all business and technology related projects as well as streamlining global operations. The Business Analysis team will support the Project Management Office and the Application Support organization to ensure all projects and operational changes are seamlessly executed. The team will ensure quality, timing, and financial delivery objectives are met by the IT teams. DUTIES & ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS: Develop strong relationships with business partners, technical teams and key vendors. Analyze business partners operations to understand strengths and weaknesses to determine opportunities to improve and/or automate processes and functions. Understand business partner strategic goals, business value streams, and lead the definition of high-level business EPICs, features and requirements. Lead value stream gap analysis and feasibility studies to assess cost, benefit, efficiency and opportunities to leverage Lean techniques to improve business and technical operations. Assist business partners and IT partners to analyze business processes, functions and procedures and identify potential projects that will lead to improved business results, save costs, and achieve strategic goals. Lead business cases and elicit requirements using various elicitation techniques that will achieve business improvements. Aid in the definition of project scope, objectives, requirements, dependencies, and technical feasibility. Involve all relevant stakeholders to ensure alignment with business goals and vendor managed solutions to ensure delivery of business value. Play a lead role in defining detailed requirements in the form of business requirement documents, breakdown EPICs into features and features into user stories and acceptance criteria. Document any process and procedure changes that support project and business goals. Assist in the development of statements of work and vendor contracts. Gain buy in and approval from subject matter experts, and stakeholders. Ensure statement of work and vendor contracts meet project needs and are approved and executed in a timely manner. Ensure team members and stakeholders understand project objectives and set appropriate expectations for delivery. Organize project team members and interested stakeholders to ensure effective communication and understanding of project scope, project deadlines, project integrations, activity assignment and ensure deliverables are met. Participate in project planning sessions with Project Managers and Scrum Masters, business stakeholders, project teams to analyze business requirements and help plan and articulate the solution. Partner with business staff, workstream leaders, vendors, and the IT team to validate and ensure appropriate project scope, project schedules, resource plans, communication plans, risk and issue management, decision and escalation management, status reporting. QUALIFICATIONS AND SKILLS: Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 / AX Finance & Operations (F&O) with Finance core capabilities, general ledger, accounts payable and accounts receivable, expense management and reporting finance and operations is REQUIRED Requirements: 8 + years of business analysis experience as a business analyst, including eliciting, analyzing, and documenting business, system, and/or non-functional/technical requirements to include scope analysis, process modeling, and data modeling. Sprint planning and developing and managing business and technical documentation for software development in the form of business requirements documents, user stories, acceptance criteria, test cases, user acceptance testing, retrospectives, functional and/or non-functional specifications. Experience with Microsoft Dynamics 365 / AX Finance & Operations (F&O) with Finance core capabilities, general ledger, accounts payable and accounts receivable, expense management and reporting finance and operations is REQUIRED. Minimum of five (5) years working with third-party vendors Must be able to assist in project planning, scope definition and SCRUM planning Strong leadership skills, communications skills, negotiation skills, organizational skills and interpersonal skills Have a partnership mindset Excellent ability to interface with executives, functional managers, key vendors, customers and employees Must be able to recognize and properly handle confidential and sensitive information in an appropriate way Exceptional critical thinking skills Educational & Experience Requirements Bachelor of Science Degree or higher; Computer Science major desirable Additional Preferred Experience Project Management Professional (PMP) certification a plus Req Benefits: Medical, Dental, Vision, 401k and more. Compensation: $140000 / yr

title: Web Developer
description: Job Title: Web Development Coding Teacher (Part Time) General Responsibilities: Under the supervision of the Director of Educational Development, plans and facilitates collaborative web development coding instructional sessions. Major Duties: Meets regularly with the Director of Educational Development Plans and facilitates learning sessions Assists students in the development of computer science and coding skills Maintains consistent communication the Director of Educational Development Models appropriate academic and social behaviors Performs other duties as assigned Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Ability to work with students of diverse ethnic backgrounds, academic profiles, and skill levels. Possess good interpersonal and organizational skills. Must demonstrate responsibility, a desire to help others, discretion, and flexibility. Knowledge and ability to instruct students in a variety of web development languages including HTML, Java, and JavaScript. Ability to instruct students on how to create a web page using specific coding languages. Ability to collect and analyze data to drive future instruction. Ability to work independently applying critical thinking skills and problem solving to various situations. Must be able to instruct students of varying skill and experience levels in multiple programs based on interest and ability. Qualifications: Must possess a bachelor's degree, teaching and/or tutoring experience, and have extensive computer science and/or coding experience.

title: Director
description: We are looking for an individual who enjoys solving problems of all types: process, people and technology. If you thrive in an environment of evolution and enjoy new challenges every day, you will thrive in leading a team of architects to work with a variety of application teams and technologies. You will work directly with application teams who are looking to take solutions to their business needs from concept to reality while moving to modern technologies. This role will draw upon all of your past experience to learn, teach and support teams of varying experience levels and unique needs while championing our technology vision. The Director, Enterprise Architecture translates business needs into technical systems solutions and architectural roadmaps; requires an in-depth understanding of how organization capabilities interrelate across the function or segment. Responsibilities Recommends products that will evolve the organization's technical infrastructure. Provides leadership in developing the organization's technical and architectural staff. Decisions are typically related to the implementation of new/updated programs or large-scale projects for the function and supporting technical/operational procedures and processes, and implements strategic plans, drives goals and objectives, and improves performance. Provides input into functions strategy. Leads a team of architects who work with various application teams from strategy to solution to implementation of modern applications / cloud technologies. Works directly with Segment IT stakeholders on technology strategy and implementation plans. Associates or contractors who live and work from home in the state of California will be provided payment for their internet expense. A minimum standard speed for optimal performance of 25x10 (25mpbs download x 10mpbs upload) is required. Satellite and Wireless Internet service is NOT allowed for this role. title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Responsibilities The Senior Software Engineer codes software applications based on business requirements. The Senior Software Engineer work assignments involve moderately complex to complex issues where the analysis of situations or data requires an in-depth evaluation of variable factors. Job Description : The Senior Software Engineer standardizes the quality assurance procedure for software. Oversees testing and debugging and develops fixes. Researches complaints and makes necessary adjustments and/or recommendations to resolve complex software related issues. Begins to influence department’s strategy. Makes decisions on moderately complex to complex issues regarding technical approach for project components, and work is performed without direction. Exercises considerable latitude in determining objectives and approaches to assignments. Maintaining parallel code base for various BPM process applications/toolkits by creating tracks Performing code merge, code development, code deployments using DevOps piplelines Ensuring no instance migration issues when migrating the instances from old snapshot to new one Required Qualifications : Education: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or related field or equivalent hands-on experience Technology: 5 or more years of experience with IBM Business Process Manager/Management (BPM) 5 or more years of experience designing, developing, and testing of software applications and/or infrastructure Hands on experience with unit testing Hands on development of Webservices using Java Experience in writing SQL statements on SQL Server or any other RDBMS Ability to use DevOps Strong experience in developing test cases using JUnit, Mocking Good experience in writing the low-level details based on the Architecture provided Skills: Ability to work with offshore team Good communication skills Available to support all the production TURNS during late night implementation on monthly basis Ability to interface with cross work stream associates Ability to work with Scrum master to develop the work estimation Ability to articulate the issue and present the solution in front of other associates Preferred Qualifications : Master's Degree Experience in Health Insurance Why Humana? It's not about what we think is important. It's what matters to you that counts. Humana offers a variety of benefits to promote the best health and well-being of our associates and their families. You'll experience the following perks as a full-time Humana employee: Compensation and Financial Security — Our pay philosophy is designed to motivate and reward associates for their skills and contributions to the company. We provide options to help you plan for your future and protect your assets: Competitive base pay, Recognition pay, 401(k) retirement savings plan (125% match for the first 6% contributed by an associate), etc. Your Whole Health — Humana's health products and services are designed to encourage personal wellness and smart healthcare decisions for you and your family: Medical, dental, and vision benefits, Health plan incentives, Paternity leave, etc. Work Perks — Humana knows your life extends outside of work. A passionate emphasis on people, choice, well-being, and innovation guide our business practices and culture. We're not just a health insurance company. If you're looking for a career that provides opportunities for growth and development in a stable industry, Humana might be the right fit for you. 60 — We have been committed to seniors' health and care for nearly 60 years. 46K — We have 46,000+ associates. #56 — Ranked #56 on the Fortune 500 list in 2019. 16.6M+ — We have 16.6+ million medical members across all 50 states. 12M — Since 2001, we have awarded more than $12 million in scholarships to children of Humana associates. title: Cloud Engineer
description: Would you like to be at the forefront of migration from multiple on prem applications including Oracle AEBS to Oracle ERP Cloud, Coupa, Oracle EPM? Humana is amid a multi-year strategic transition to cloud. Combined with the right talent, technology holds the key to many complex business challenges. Our Finance IT team is looking for an Oracle Fusion Financial OCI solutions engineer with a proven track record of delivering solutions in a fast-paced, agile environment. The Sr Cloud Solution Engineer will assist with a variety of ERP implementation-related initiatives and tasks in support of Humana’s current and future use of ERP Cloud solutions. Does this sound like a great fit? APPLY TODAY! Responsibilities A successful candidate will be able to analyze business needs to help ensure Oracle ERP Cloud solution meets the enterprise and business objectives by combining industry best practices, product knowledge, and business acumen. You will need to possess the ability to exercise good judgment and business acumen in selecting methods and techniques to connect our cloud applications to cloud services or on-prem applications. Specific Duties Experience and complete knowledge of OCI Administration with strong understanding of Tenancy, VCN, Compartments, Network Layers, handling firewalls, subnet, storage options, FSS, Block Volume, Object storage. OCI infra-administration including installation, configuration, migrations, tuning, patching, administration & monitoring. Hands on experience in writing and modifying Terraform scripts for application deployments on OCI and for managing OCI Infrastructure. Hands on experience with performance tuning, hardware upgrades, and resource optimization as required. Configure CPU, memory, and disk partitions as required and ensure high availability of infrastructure. Experience in ERP Application of OS patches and upgrades on a regular basis and upgrade administrative tools and utilities. Configure/add new services as necessary. Experience around handling OS related or Application related security vulnerabilities is an added advantage. Exposure to using code repository like GIT. Hands on Experience with provisioning storage, compute nodes, network. and understanding requirements for the same. Experience with Certificate renewals on OCI. Experience with security list, Ingress, Egress, Subnets, SSL, Route Table configurations within OCI and managing applications in multi-tenant layers. Understanding and hands on experience of HA architecture in an OCI environment. Strong understanding of HA concepts in DR and setting up on Infrastructure for DR Site. Experience with IaaS solutions: virtual machines/networks, on-premises/hybrid cloud computing, cloud identity, security models, cloud monitoring, logging, local and cloud storage. Should be well-versed with ITIL based service delivery for Incident Management, Change Management, Problem Management, Capacity Management, Configuration Management. Effective collaboration with infrastructure teams, application development teams, testing and release teams Ensure the effective daily operation of the production / database applications and provides administrative support for new implementations, upgrades, and migrations Required Qualifications Functional professional with 3+ Oracle Fusion Financial or Oracle OCI, VCN IDCS cloud implementation as a senior team member. Experience migration Oracle ERP cloud Hands on development experience with various cloud, SaaS, and IaaS Demonstrable experience implementing Oracle ERP Cloud solutions across different industries (healthcare Insurance industry is a plus) with large-scale implementation project experience within global organizations. Experience in integrating ERP Cloud with other systems using middleware, Webservices, and REST APIs using Oracle Integration Cloud (OIC) Use of modern practices to increase the speed of delivering software (e.g., Agile, DevOps, test automation, etc.) Delivered projects and operations using agile delivery principles and teams is a plus Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills Strong written and verbal communication skills BS or MS in Computer Science or equivalent Preferred Qualifications Oracle OCI certifications #LI-REMOTE This is a remote position To ensure Home or Hybrid Home/Office associates’ ability to work effectively, the self-provided internet service of Home or Hybrid Home/Office associates must meet the following criteria: At minimum, a download speed of 25 Mbps and an upload speed of 10 Mbps is recommended to support Humana applications, per associate. Wireless, Wired Cable or DSL connection is suggested. Satellite, cellular and microwave connection can be used only if they provide an optimal connection for associates. The use of these methods must be approved by leadership. (See Wireless, Wired Cable or DSL Connection in Exceptions, Section 7.0 in this policy.) Humana WILL NOT pay for or reimburse Home or Hybrid Home/Office associates for any portion of the cost of their self-provided internet service, with the exception of associates who live or work from Home in the state of California, Illinois, Montana, or South Dakota. Associates who live and work from Home in the state of California, Illinois, Montana, or South Dakota will be provided a bi-weekly payment for their internet expense. Humana will provide Home or Hybrid Home/Office associates with telephone equipment appropriate to meet the business requirements for their position/job.
