Experienced with Linux networks, Security and IPC programming Required Skills, Experience and Education Embedded Linux Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering Minimum 7 years software development experience using C/C++. Software Version Management Use of software debuggers and emulators, compilers, linkers, and build environments Must have experience launching products into production Must be able to read electrical schematics and integrate and debug hardware, software, sensors. Have knowledge of and experience using Lab equipment (oscilloscopes, meters, logic analyzers etc.) Project Management. Plan, estimate, sequence, and measure completed work. Collaborate cross functionally to investigate, root-cause, and solve technical issues Conduct Software Design and Code reviews Beneficial Skills, Experience, and Education Formal Software Behavior specification approaches such as UML, OO, State Machines, Data Flow Diagrams, Flow-Charts. Experience with Software Quality Control, issues tracking, gate reviews, review checklists Hardware design and troubleshooting knowledge. Formal Software Test Methods, tools, procedures Software Quality Assurance measurement and improvement Development of software under IEC, ISO, UL, DO-178C, or other formal software Quality Management Systems. The ISO/IEC 12207 Systems and software engineering – Software life cycle process

title: Web Developer
description: Job Title: Web Development Coding Teacher (Part Time) General Responsibilities: Under the supervision of the Director of Educational Development, plans and facilitates collaborative web development coding instructional sessions. Major Duties: Meets regularly with the Director of Educational Development Plans and facilitates learning sessions Assists students in the development of computer science and coding skills Maintains consistent communication the Director of Educational Development Models appropriate academic and social behaviors Performs other duties as assigned Required Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: Ability to work with students of diverse ethnic backgrounds, academic profiles, and skill levels. Possess good interpersonal and organizational skills. Must demonstrate responsibility, a desire to help others, discretion, and flexibility. Knowledge and ability to instruct students in a variety of web development languages including HTML, Java, and JavaScript. Ability to instruct students on how to create a web page using specific coding languages. Ability to collect and analyze data to drive future instruction. Ability to work independently applying critical thinking skills and problem solving to various situations. Must be able to instruct students of varying skill and experience levels in multiple programs based on interest and ability. Qualifications: Must possess a bachelor's degree, teaching and/or tutoring experience, and have extensive computer science and/or coding experience.

title: Senior Electrical Engineer
description: SMT Corp is looking to hire a Sr. Electrical Engineer for our new state of the art Electrical Test Lab. The Electrical Test Lab is a part of the SMT Corp counterfeit mitigation testing process which is used to authenticate and screen electronic components. SMT Corp’s customer base is primarily composed of defense, aerospace, and high-reliability companies which require extensive testing in order to purchase electronic components from independent distributors. Due to the lack of traceability, SMT Corp utilizes industry standard testing methods such as AS6171 or AS6081 to authenticate the material. As a part of that process, the Electrical Test Lab performs electrical testing to validate that the components meet the original component manufacturer’s specifications and quality requirements. As an electrical test engineer at SMT Corp, the following items are part of the job responsibilities: Interpret customer testing flowdowns, understand electrical component datasheets, and provide electrical testing quotes to SMT Corp sales people. Design test fixtures for a wide variety of electrical components from passives such as resistors and capacitors to complex active devices like FPGAs and CPUs. Write software to control/automate test equipment to perform electrical testing of components. Write reports summarizing electrical testing results, test methods, and all relevant testing information. Technical support for management, QC, sales, and component authentication groups. Communicate with customers (technical and non-technical) regarding electrical testing requirements/problems and related information. At a minimum, test engineers are required to have the following: Bachelor’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science Engineering: SMT Corp would prefer that candidates have the following: Master’s Degree in Electrical Engineering, Computer Engineering, or Computer Science Engineering Experience with designing and laying out PCB test fixtures for electronic components. Experience with National Instruments LabView software to control and automate electronic component testing. Experience with complex digital device such as FPGAs, Microprocessors, and Microcontrollers. Experience with Advantest test equipment and software. Company Overview: About SMT Corp. Based in Sandy Hook, CT and founded in 1998, SMT Corp. is the industry leader for sourcing and authentication of DMSMS, obsolete and hard-to-find electronics components for Aerospace, Defense and critical infrastructure. SMT Corp. is an accredited and recognized expert with full on-site authentication and electrical testing services to mitigate the risk of counterfeit, cloned, altered or substandard products from entering the critical systems supply chain. With more than a half-billion components in stock representing over 1,200 major component manufacturers, SMT Corp. maintains one of the largest “ready to ship” electronic component inventories in the world. SMT Corp’s primary focus is Aerospace & Defense, and other high reliability industries, that require the highest in component quality, traceability and inspection documentation for mission critical applications. The SMT Corp. mission is to provide the highest quality products and value-added services directly to government, OEM (Original Equipment Manufacturer) and CM (Contract Manufacturer) providers as well as both franchised and non-franchised distributors. Come join a growing company with a commitment to provide our customers the highest quality products and services, competitive pricing, and fastest response time in the industry. Industry leader in strategic DMS sourcing, counterfeit mitigation and component authentication testing Quality standards compliance includes ISO9001:2015, AS9120B, ANSI/ESD-20.20:2014, ISO/IEC 17025:2017, AS6081 & AS6171 Advanced electrical & environmental testing and up-screening One stop shop for strategic sourcing, in-house authentication and testing - ensuring no break in the chain of custody SMT Corp. is an Equal Opportunity Employer Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) 401(k) matching Dental insurance Employee assistance program Employee discount Health insurance Life insurance Paid time off Vision insurance Schedule: Monday to Friday Overtime Application Question(s): Do you have experience using National Instruments LabView software to control test equipment to measure electrical parameters (voltages, currents, timing delays)? Do you have experience creating programs for complex digital devices such as FPGAs (VHDL, Verilog, ect)? Education: Bachelor's (Required) Experience: Electrical Engineering: 3 years (Required) Language: English (Required) Work Location: In person

title: Senior Software Engineer
description: Who is Recruiting from Scratch: Recruiting from Scratch is a premier talent firm that focuses on placing the best product managers, software, and hardware talent at innovative companies. Our team is 100% remote and we work with teams across the United States to help them hire. We work with companies funded by the best investors including Sequoia Capital, Lightspeed Ventures, Tiger Global Management, A16Z, Accel, DFJ, and more. https://www.recruitingfromscratch.com/ About Our Client At our client, their mission is to make self-driving for everyone. They build autonomous driving software for automakers, based on a breakthrough in artificial intelligence that finally makes highway autonomy safe and scalable for the consumer car market. Our client has 100+ employees across its headquarters in Mountain View and additional offices in Dallas and Sydney. They have raised $165 million from investors including Mike Speiser at Sutter Hill Ventures, Keith Rabois at Founders Fund, and Vinod Khosla at Khosla Ventures. The Role Our client is looking for more senior IC engineers to join their team. These talented engineers will fuel our progress solving the most challenging technical problem of the past two decades: true self-driving. Software is at the center of our solution and we’re looking for people whose curiosity and passion are matched by their desire to get things done and make an impact as we make our vision a reality. The broad spectrum of work ranges from low level platform bring up to building pipelines for analyzing big data; engineers are matched with specific teams and projects based on their demonstrated strengths and interests. What you will do: Design software that runs on embedded systems in autonomous vehicles and in data centers such as: Fault-tolerant distributed runtime systems for co-ordination and execution of parts of autonomous driving system Domain-specific language for expressing aspects of the driving system Distributed database systems for processing, querying, analyzing, and engineering/validating models based on recorded video and vehicle sensor data Execute mission-critical systems engineering work including, but not limited to: autonomous driving runtime, operating systems, embedded systems, large-scale distributed databases, model training systems, performance optimization, and software/hardware system architecture Requirements: BS/MS/PhD in Computer Science or related field 8+ years of software development experience Core competency in general software engineer practice Nice to haves: Experience in low level platform bring-up, device drivers, and embedded operating systems History of building efficient protocols for secure data transfer Knowledge in handling big data using tools such as Apache Spark Expertise with compliers and operating systems Compensation Compensation for this role consists of a base salary and an options grant, with the base salary expected to range from $175,000 to $250,000+. Individual compensation will be commensurate with the candidate’s experience. https://www.recruitingfromscratch.com/

title: Network Security Engineer
description: Job Summary: The IT Network Security Engineer will be supervised by the IT Manager. The Network Security Engineer will be responsible for network security monitoring, incident response, administering and maintaining all aspects of the IT security infrastructure. This also includes network related security requirements; planning, implementing and testing of network and security systems. In addition, this position is responsible for responding to direct inquiries from users on subjects of security and networking connectivity performance issues. This individual will prepare network and any related security standards, policies, and procedures. The Network Engineer will also work closely with IT Manager and IT infrastructure supervisor on various network security projects and initiatives. Principal Duties and Responsibilities: The Network Security Engineer will be responsible for providing proactive network security monitoring, analyzing the network for problems and vulnerabilities, creating incident response, operation support, and desktop support as necessary. The City of West Haven Network Security Engineer will be responsible for determining network and related security requirements; planning, implementing and testing of network and security systems, preparing network and related security standards, policies, procedures; and performing associated operational support duties Research and evaluates current network and related security systems to propose and implement network system enhancements on Network Switches, Routers, Internet Firewall Services, VPN and other Network Management devices The Network Security Engineer will conduct periodic vulnerability and security risk assessments for all remote location with other City of West Haven entities on information Security issues Designs, installs, supports, and maintain new network and related security hardware and software infrastructure The Network Security Engineer will be responsible for public cloud security, design and implement technologies for enforcement of security controls using cloud security Posture Management and Workload Protection Platforms Work as part of a small team providing technical support for The City of West Haven distributed Windows desktops and Laptops, Windows Active Directory, Office365, Ruckus LAN, Fortigate , Nutanix AHV Server 2019, ShoreTel IP Telephony, Comcast/CrownCastle managed network. Schedule after hours support duties for network and infrastructure maintenance patches and upgrades Develop network and related security documentation, including diagrams and work instructions In-depth knowledge of architecture, engineering, and operations of at least one enterprise SIEM platform (e.g. LogRhythm/McAfee Enterprise Security Manager, FortiSiem, QRadar, LogPoint, Splunk) Required / Desired Knowledge, Experiences and Skills: 3+ years of network security experience engineering solutions for Windows Desktop operating systems; e.g. Windows 7 - Windows 10 is required Experience working with Active Directory in a distributed environment is required Thorough understanding of enterprise datacenter technologies including Networking, Security, TCP/IP and DNS Experience with Malware, Anti-virus, Endpoint Detection and Response (EDR), and Network Detection and Response (NDR) solutions 3+ years of technical and troubleshooting experience working Microsoft Windows desktop OS and Microsoft Office is required 3+ years of experience in virtualization, managing MS Windows environment, network performance tuning, network design and implementation 3+ years of experience with Office 365 platforms including Intune, and Azure AD, SharePoint Experience with AWS and Azure is a plus Strong project management skills required Experience documenting IT processes and standards is a must Experience with Microsoft Visio is a required Experience with network, IP Phones, T1Circuits, data center and manufacturing vendor as needed to address networking or security related issues Strong working knowledge of LAN and WAN connectivity issues and support in a Windows Server, Active Directory environment is preferred Experience with ShoreTel Voice over IP products including ShoreTel Communications Manager (Call Manager), voice gateway routers, and IP Telephony endpoints is desirable Experience working with virtualized environments such as Nutanix,VMware, is a strong plus Expertise in understanding threat models to better protect against attacks or detect new vectors Experience evaluating and testing all cloud and in house platforms network initiatives for security issues Experience managing desktop environment using Microsoft Active Directory Group Policy Objects (GPOs) is required Experience working in Municipality is preferred Experience leading network efforts to prevent, mitigate and investigate security incidents Support experience and good organizational skills are required This position directly impacts the availability of all production systems for the City of West Haven. On-call support and a willingness to work off-hours and weekends as needed is required Minimum Qualifications: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, relevant technical field, or equivalent practical experience. CCNA,CCNP, Network+, Security+, Security Certifications Special Requirement: Must have a valid Connecticut driver’s license Must have experience with Next Generation Firewall (Fortinet & Palo Alto) Must have experience with basic scripting language (Powershell,python,etc)

title: Infrastructure Engineer
description: We have an exciting direct hire opportunity in New Haven, CT. Preference is for someone who can do a hybrid model, and be onsite a few days a week. The Senior Database Infrastructure Engineer provides engineering services and 24x7x365 operational support associated with clients Database platforms across the enterprise. Responsible for building, deploying, documenting, and maintaining functional, optimized, secure and highly recoverable Database Management Systems in all environments. *Core skills are DB2 on the mainframe, experience with SQL Server and Azure, as well has distributed Linux server experience. \ *No agency's please. Must be authorized to work for any US Employer.  Recommends, installs, configures, monitors, and maintains Database Management Systems both on premises and in the cloud.  Enforces Data Governance Policies including database transaction and security audits.  Strong understanding of database structures, theories, principles, and practices.  Provides Database Administration services in support of information technology and business project activities, often serving as members of a project team.  Troubleshoot, manage, and resolve incident, problem, service request and change management assignments associated with Database Management systems across the enterprise. On-call and/or afterhours work as required.  Design Database Backup solutions which are highly recoverable for all Databases across the enterprise. Frequently requires engagement with internal client departments, external partners and/or vendors.  Monitors Database performance and responds to issues for all supported Database Management Systems.  Monitor, optimize and allocate physical data storage for all supported Database Management Systems. Job Responsibilities: The following duties reflect the primary responsibilities performed by employees in this job. Incumbent(s) may be required to perform additional, position-specific duties. 1. Analyze and review proposed Database Management Systems based on industry experience, research, vendor interaction, proof of concepts, labs, and compliance. 2. Install, setup and configure Database Management Systems in support of information technology and business project activities, serving as a member of a project team. 3. Upgrade, maintain, and administer Database Management Systems across all platforms including initial installations, patches, and hotfixes. 4. Enforce Data Governance Policies for all Database Management Systems across the enterprise. 5. Work with application development staff to develop database coding standards, and quality assurance policies and procedures and provide recommendations for Database performance tuning. 6. Accountable for management and resolution of incident, problem, service request and change management assignments for all supported Database Management Systems. Provides support & services (evaluate, diagnose & resolve) to other internal ITS departments for diagnosing Database performance issues and recommending solutions. 7. Accountable for the backup and recoverability of all Databases across the enterprise. 8. Responsible for monitoring Database performance and responding to issues for all supported Database Management Systems. 9. Responsible for monitoring, optimizing, and allocating physical data storage for all supported Database Management Systems. 10. Participates in disaster recovery & business continuity testing for all Database platforms Knowledge, Skills, and Abilities: The depth and breadth of knowledge within the position’s field or specialty that is required to effectively perform the responsibilities of this position, e.g., insurance, client structure and processes. Describe the type and level of skills required to handle the position’s responsibilities, e.g., mathematical/analytical, communication, typing, spreadsheet.  Strong oral and written communication skills  Self-starter with good work ethic and attitude  Ability to research, recommend, and develop cost-effective solutions  Analytical and problem-solving skills  Sound judgment in decision making Systems/Technical Knowledge:  z\OS (Mainframe) Operating Systems: Windows OS, Linux\Unix, Z\OS (Mainframe)  Database Management Systems: DB2 on z\OS, SQL Server on Premise, SQL Server Azure, DB2 LUW (Windows and Linux), DB2 on z\OS, Snowflake, and other cloud hosted database technology.  Database Management tools and applications: SPF Editor and JCL (Mainframe), BMC Mainview, some knowledge of COBOL is a plus, Power BI, SSMS, SSIS, SSRS, SSAS (SQL Server), Data Vault, SQL and T-SQL, (SQL Server and DB2), stored procedures, Cron scheduling and VI Editor (Linux), SPF Editor and JCL (Mainframe), BMC Mainview, some knowledge of COBOL is a plus.  Database Management scripting: in depth knowledge of SQL and T-SQL, Stored Procedures in a relational Database environment, Windows, and Linux scripting.  Microsoft Office, including Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Visio.  Collaborates with Strategy and Architecture, Solution Delivery Teams, Infrastructure Operations, and End User Services to ensure business requirements translate into business solutions resulting in business value.  Clearly communicates solution design and support requirements to tier 1 and 2 supports groups using a variety of communication styles.  Collaborates with Senior Solutions Architects and Enterprise Solutions Delivery teams to implement solutions.  Collaborates with stakeholders at all levels  Cultivates a knowledge of emerging technologies and best practices and evangelizes them within the Enterprise Infrastructure Services and Solutions Delivery teams.  Communicates with outside vendors and managed service providers regarding new and emerging technologies, product implementation and product support. Education and Experience Requirements: Education: BS or BA in Computer Science, Information Systems or related field or equivalent combination of experience and training. Experience: 7 to 10+ years of experience in the administration of Database Management Systems or equivalent combination of training and experience. Strong z\OS and DB2 on z\OS (Mainframe) background and experience is a plus. Strong Azure background and experience is a plus. Licensing/Certification: ITIL IV certified Performance Indicators:  Clarity of communications.  Systems and service availability.  Successful deployment of network and telecom systems and services  Management and prevention of critical incidents.  Tier 3 service problem resolution.  Database Management solution recommendations.  Customer service orientation: feedback on service provided and problem resolution.  Ability to quickly provide environment diagrams and documentation when requested. Decision Making:  Contributes to decisions that affect the Department.  Makes decisions on corrective actions required for major incidents, seriousness of issues and when to escalate.  Discusses complex issues and problems with Team Leader or Manager; formulates recommendations for their consideration. Problem Solving & Complexity:  Requires application of specific Database Management Systems related technical skills and expertise.  Formulates and presents recommendations for resolving complex issues and problems to Manager.  Participates in the identification and evaluation of alternative design options and tradeoffs.  Reviews, verifies, and improves designs against specifications.  Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities.  Ability to effectively prioritize and execute tasks in a high-pressure environment.  Strong interpersonal and oral communication skills.  Skilled at working within a team-oriented, collaborative environment.  Ability to present ideas and solutions in business-friendly and user-friendly language.  Highly self-motivated and self-directed.  Keen attention to detail Job Type: Full-time Benefits: 401(k) Dental insurance Health insurance Vision insurance Schedule: 8 hour shift On call Work Location: In person

title: Senior .NET Developer
description: Minimum Required Skills: C# / .NET, Consumer Facing Software, Linux, SQL, HTML/CSS/Javascript If you are a Senior .NET Developer with experience, please read on! Based in Farmington, we leading providers of technology products and services to the building systems and aerospace industries worldwide! Currently, we're looking for a motivated Senior .NET Developer that has experience with .NET and C# experience to join our tight-nit team. Ideal candidate should have 4-7+ years of engineering experience. Experience and understanding with customer facing software preferred. Develop software in C, C++, C#, Java, and/or Python. Experience with multiple software development languages and an ability to quickly learn new ones preferred. Successful candidates should have experience in both software theory and practice, including full software development lifecycle and diverse software project management approaches, e.g., Agile and TSP, software modeling using languages such as UML, software metrics and control and signal processing algorithm development. Develop software for a variety of target platforms including Windows, Linux, and various embedded platforms. Experience with Drupal preferred. Understanding basics of cybersecurity preferred. The minimum education requirement is a B.S. degree in Software Engineering, Computer Science or a closely related technical field (e.g. Systems Engineering, Electrical Engineering).

title: Operations Manager
description: About Us Cheil Worldwide is the 10th -largest creative agency in the world. Headquartered in Seoul, South Korea, we were founded by Samsung in 1973 to grow its local and global business. While Samsung is still one of our main clients, our roster has evolved to include other globally recognized brands such as Adidas, PayPal, ESPN, Lego, Coca-Cola, Nivea, Starbucks and many more. About the Role Digital Ops Manager The Digital Ops Manager [Local Operations Manager (LOM)] will join our Global Delivery team for a premier client. The DOM will be the key contact between the Global Client Team, Cheil team and local region / market ensuring proactive and clear communication. The ideal candidate will have a good understanding of complex projects and dependencies, be able to work to tight deadlines and according to set SLAs to provide excellent service. The DOM will be responsible for continuously monitoring and improving processes and ways-of-working. As the Local DOM you will be part of a unique and active team within the Cheil family. Overseeing the day-to-day operations of local web & commerce operations to drive forward timely implementation of requests self-sufficiently and in cooperation with the Web Operations production teams. You will be expected to be in local client offices once or twice a week to collaborate and build strong relationships. Responsibilities : Build and maintain a strong relationship with client management and Local Market Managers. Coordinate with local market resources on all local initiatives requiring delivery within web and commerce systems, collecting and raising briefs within ticketing systems. Triaging requests and ensuring all required information is present for execution of tasks. Configuring within the systems small local changes that can be accomplished in order to streamline speed to market. Briefing into the centralized Production Center more complex requests and ensuring the speed and quality of delivery from the central team. Liaising with other departments for issue resolution that prevent requests being delivered on time and escalating where necessary production risks to key stakeholders. Reviewing reports to ensure metrics are on point and flagging performance lags. Implement action plans to recover any performance issues. Act as the local systems knowledge (SME) for feasibility, assessment of timelines and providing prioritization into the Production Center. Background & Experience: Broad web and digital knowledge, an aptitude for troubleshooting and problem solving as well as assisting or mentoring other members of the team Establish goals, prioritize activities, and follow through to completion Work both independently and as part of a multidisciplinary team Explain technical concepts in ways non-technical people can understand A self-taught striver who can push themselves to become a key player in the organization for both the local region as well as the Global Web Operations. Ability in and affinity to work both in a team environment and as an individual contributor, as appropriate. Solution-oriented mindset Ability to display calm under stressful conditions. You are the port in the center of the storm. Excellent problem-solving and planning skills; a natural bridge builder. Requirements : Bachelor's degree in computer sciences, software engineering, technology management, business management, or similar preferred Minimum 3+ years of experience in Adobe Experience Manager/Hybris, additional content management systems experience is a plus Web Authoring and Publishing skills using AEM platform is essential. Working knowledge of Hybris preferred. Familiar with Google Analytics, Adobe Analytics and other reporting tools Proven customer relationship management background with technical experience. Strong computer, project management and ticketing technology experience including but not limited to Jira, Asana, Confluence, Workfront, Slack, Teams, Trello, MS Office suite, Google Sheets, etc. Strong written and verbal communication skills. Good presentation/public speaking skills for both technical and non-technical audiences. Willing to travel when required. Must be able to be on-site in Stamford at least 3 days per week Some supervisory experience preferred. The salary range for this role in CT is $60000-$80000 per annum. Final base salary will be determined based on several factors which may include but are not limited to location, work experience, skills, knowledge, education and/or certifications.

title: Director of Engineering
description: We are looking for a director of engineering to lead our engineering department and help us build innovative products. As the Director of Engineering you will help drive the technology road map and be responsible for its execution by leading, mentoring and developing a top tier development team. Ultimately you will help drive the evolution of our product to build a world-class, reliable, highly available and easy to use platform. You will be asked to consider the big picture – collaborating cross functionally, as well as evaluating and executing on trade-offs to maximize business impact for the company. In this role you will also manage our infrastructure and ensure all internal systems operate securely and effectively. To be successful in this role, you should be confident in managing Inbox Health’s engineering teams while, at the same time, setting goals, budgets and timelines as we continue building our core platform’s functionality. We also expect you to oversee and coach the technical teams in charge of our integrations with external partners and oversee all software development plans from ideation to execution. These include API vendors and other external systems, specifically healthcare Practice Management Systems, claim submission engines and as well as the payment processing, statement mailing vendors, and other digital communication technology that powers our services. Ultimately, you’ll ensure our entire software engineering department is operating at top efficiency and meeting the company's technical growth goals. Through directly hiring, reviewing and managing our team you can ensure productivity and help our company grow as we deliver value to patients, doctors and medical billing companies by streamlining their communication and payment processing platform. Requirements You will lead a talented team of engineers in technical areas that will have a tremendous impact on the company. Coordinate with the three core engineering teams and the product team, customer success teams, and external stakeholders for maintaining legacy integrations and tools as well as launching new ones You will partner with cross-functional stakeholders to define the roadmap and vision for the team and deliver immense impact. Scale the team by recruiting, retaining and developing highly talented engineers across different disciplines. Managing the day-to-day Agile practices of the team, striving for predictable and repeatable success. Provide technical guidance and roll up your sleeves with hands-on contributions when necessary. Rolling up your sleeves with hands on problem solving when necessary. Review and update policies relevant to internal systems and equipment Managing, mentoring, coaching, and moving the personal development of individuals on your team forward. Oversee front-end and back-end development teams and their projects Monitor reliability and performance of all internal systems to suggest improvements Ensure compliance with security regulations Manage software development projects by setting requirements, goals and timelines Prepare and manage the engineering department’s budget Enhance and improve bug-tracking, triage, and reporting processes and resolution Implement innovative technologies and decide on the technical direction/architecture of the team Requirements and skills B.S., M.S., or PhD. in Computer Science or equivalent 7+ years of engineering experience in the industry 3+ years of management experience Strong hands-on technical leadership and a strong product sense. Strong track record of execution and collaboration with multi-disciplinary teams and cross-functional partners Ability to lead and grow an excellent engineering team in a rapidly changing business environment Work experience as a director of engineering or in a similar senior-level position at an engineering department Extensive experience with cloud technologies and modern human-computer interfaces Hands-on experience in back-end and front-end development Strong understanding of agile methodologies Leadership abilities with a strategic mind Excellent project management skills Benefits Location : Three days/week in our New Haven, Connecticut-based office is required. Compensation : The annual base salary for this role is $175,000 - $200,000. The actual base pay within this range depends on many factors, such as education, skills and experience. Base pay is only one part of Inbox Health's competitive total compensation package which includes benefits, bonus, perks and equity. title: Senior Business Analyst
description: Great company. Great people. Great opportunities. The Operational Excellence Senior Analyst (a.k.a Senior Business Analyst - Operations) will perform complex analysis and financial/operational modeling on Ops Excellence projects. Responsible for end-to-end analysis, including creating a hypothesis, data mining, validating findings with the field, and delivering insights. Proactively identify performance trends, and make program recommendations based on analytical findings. Provide analytic support to Ops Excellence leaders across the organization and maintain a deep expertise in operational systems and data structure. If you would enjoy the chance to make your mark with the world’s largest equipment rental provider, consider a future with United Rentals. We will provide the tools, the technology and the support you need to do the job right. You will also be supported by a strong management team that will help you achieve your goals. Responsibilities: Provide in-depth analytics in support of strategic projects within OE to facilitate decision making and optimize results from key corporate initiatives. Lead development of project dashboards and scorecards that drive insight into operations performance across the company. Gather metrics, provide in-depth analytics reporting, including analyses of trend, variance, correlation, cause-effect, etc. Develop and manage reporting processes to measure the impact of Operational Excellence activities and field implementations across the company. Build predictive analysis to identify strategic operational changes, and model the potential impact on cost, productivity, and revenue. Effectively communicate analysis findings and/or recommendations in an executive-level format, including data visualization. Lead efforts with the core OE team on vendor evaluation and project KPI identification. Perform data analysis and develop business cases for programs. Collaborate with OE colleagues and department leaders to determine requirements across the program and broader organization, identifying dependencies in the roadmap. Manage cross-functional projects independently, including identifying necessary resources, managing a schedule, and delivering outputs. Provide support during specialized events such as Annual Management, Board of Directors, Executive Operating Committee meetings. Maintain an intimate knowledge of United Rentals data systems and structure. Primary point of contact for a broad range of Operational data & analytics questions from across the company. Coach peers on analytical tools, and build training guides as required to support broad launches of metrics and scorecards. Conduct branch visits to shadow employees using systems and tools to understand processes and needs of our internal customers. Requirements: Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Mathematics, Information Management, Statistics, Econometrics, Operations Research or Analytical/Quantitative Methods Graduate degree in business or mathematics preferred 6 Sigma or equivalent statistical analysis training preferred Minimum 3-5 years’ of analysis experience with exposure to business operations Broad range of experience with data analysis and modeling Ability to work directly with databases (SQL proficiency) Advanced Analytics tools such as R or SAS is required Visualization and BI tools such as Tableau, Cognos High level MS-Office computer skills, advanced excel & PPT skills Strong communication skills; intermediate presentation skills Self-starter with willingness/ability to seek out new approaches/solutions to complex business challenges High sense of urgency and ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment Able to effectively manage multiple high profile projects at one time At United Rentals, the largest equipment rental company, we believe that it takes great employees to build a great organization – and we’re passionate about helping our people grow professionally and embrace teamwork in everything they do. Our culture is based on our corporate values and centers on mutual respect, job satisfaction, diversity and a shared responsibility to build a better future. What's in it for you? U.S. Full Time roles : Best in class benefits offering includes medical, dental, vision, flex spending and health savings accounts; 401(k) retirement with company match; life and disability insurance; and paid time off including sick, vacation, holidays, and paid parental leave. Comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities. U.S. Non-Full Time roles: Benefits offering includes 401(k) retirement with company match; paid time off including sick, vacation and holidays; and comprehensive training and development and career growth opportunities. Canada: Best in class benefits package which includes medical, dental & vision, RRSP/DPSP*, paid time off, comprehensive training and development, and career growth opportunities. Offered for full time roles, non-full time eligibility in select provinces. Mutual respect for the dignity and fundamental rights of all persons defines our culture. United Rentals, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer and makes employment decisions regardless of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, genetic information, citizenship status, veteran status, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, or any other status protected by law. If you need a reasonable accommodation at any point of the application process, please email careers@ur.com for assistance.

title: Research Analyst
description: About Sacred Heart University: As the second-largest independent Catholic university in New England, and one of the fastest-growing private doctoral institutions in the U.S., Sacred Heart University is a national leader in shaping higher education for the 21st century. SHU offers nearly 90 undergraduate, graduate, doctoral and certificate programs on its Fairfield, Conn., campus. Sacred Heart also has a campus in Dingle, Ireland, and offers online programs. More than 10,000 students attend the University's nine colleges and schools: Arts & Sciences; Communication, Media & the Arts; Social Work; Computer Science & Engineering; Health Professions; the Isabelle Farrington College of Education & Human Development; the Jack Welch College of Business & Technology; the Dr. Susan L. Davis, R.N., & Richard J. Henley College of Nursing; and St. Vincent's College. Sacred Heart stands out from other Catholic institutions as it was established and led by laity. The contemporary Catholic university is rooted in the rich Catholic intellectual tradition and the liberal arts, and at the same time cultivates students to be forward thinkers who enact change-in their own lives, professions and in their communities. The Princeton Review includes SHU in its Best 388 Colleges-2023 Edition, and Best Business Schools-2023 Edition. Sacred Heart is home to the award-winning, NPR-affiliated radio station, WSHU, a Division I athletics program and an impressive performing arts program that includes choir, band, dance and theatre. www.sacredheart.edu View SHU's Faculty Experts Here Job Description: PRINCIPAL DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES: Sacred Heart University welcomes applications for the position of Institutional Research Analyst. Reporting to the Assistant Director of Institutional Data and reporting, the Institutional Research Analyst conducts research and analysis across the institution in support of university operations and strategic initiatives. Responsibilities include compiling institutional data and information to fulfill state, federal and accreditation reporting requirements; qualitative research via surveys, including survey development and administration; benchmarking analysis on external ranking surveys; report writing, including data interpretation and visualization; and completion of ad-hoc requests. This position serves as the primary coordinator for external ranking surveys (e.g., US News, Princeton Review), standardized surveys (e.g., NSSE) and internal surveys occurring annually or as needed and maintains responsibility for all aspects related to the surveys. Responsibilities: Coordinate the submission of external federal, state, and ranking surveys in a timely and accurate manner by reviewing instructions or guidelines, communicating with pertinent operational areas, and preparing data for final submission. With an understanding of data models and schemas, develop and modify reports and SQL queries to aid in data extraction from a variety of systems and databases. Oversee all phases of survey administration for institutional surveys, including creation and implementation of questionnaires, survey administration, data analysis, and report design. Coordinate with operational areas regarding surveys that support institutional metrics and goals (e.g., Career Services, Advising). Summarize results of analysis for varied audiences utilizing a mixture of text, graphs, and tables. Respond to internal and external data requests as needed by providing research and assessment information or by summarizing data and results. Other duties as assigned Requirements: KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS NEEDED: Bachelor's degree in social sciences, statistics, measurement or related field required; Master's degree desirable. Equivalent experience will be considered. At least two years of experience with social science research, which includes data collection, quantitative analysis, interpretation of data, report writing and presentation with data visualizations. Experience in higher education with compliance reporting (e.g., IPEDS, CDS, etc.) and ranking surveys (e.g., US News, Princeton Review) highly desirable. Strong skills in using spreadsheets, database and reporting systems, such as Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft SQL Server and Microsoft Reporting Services. Experience with survey development (Qualtrics), Ellucian Colleague ERP (or similar), statistical analysis, and the Microsoft Office Suite or comparable programs. Facility with Excel is required. Candidates must be detail-oriented, have strong verbal and written communication skills, ability to communicate results effectively, ability to manage large datasets and a grasp of higher education issues and trends. Commitment to student success and diversity, equity and inclusion is required Experience in document management using SharePoint is a plus Additional Information: Statement of Personal & Organizational Responsibility for Inclusive Excellence Inclusive Excellence is the recognition that our institution's success is dependent on how well we value, engage, and include the rich diversity of students, staff, faculty, administrators, alums, and surrounding community. It is a mastery of inclusion that fosters a consistent sense of belonging. Inclusive Excellence is aspirational and is the pillar that guides the mission, vision, and function of this unit. To achieve Inclusive Excellence, our personal and organizational responsibilities are to: Actively promote a collegial environment and consciously apply our mission and values to create a culture of inclusion and belonging; a safe space where all may thrive and succeed. Participate in educational and developmental activities to increase awareness and competencies of issues related to diversity, equity, inclusion, and belonging; apply that understanding to guide your approach to all aspects of your job and the community as a whole. Demonstrate that we are "Stronger Together" as described in the Office for Inclusive Excellence statements. Application Instructions: Please apply online, faxes and emails will not be accepted. A cover letter is appreciated. Sacred Heart University is a space that respects and embraces differences, recognizes the unique contributions that individuals can make, and creates a community that maximizes the potential of all faculty and staff. As an equal opportunity employer, we encourage applications from qualified candidates who reflect the wider world in which we live. Category: Institutional Research Subscribe: Department: AVP Office [AVP] Locations: Fairfield, CT Posted: Sep 6, 2023 Closes: Open Until Filled Type: Exempt Position ID: 167122

title: Senior Engineer
description: In this age of disruption, organizations need to navigate the future with confidence by tapping into the power of data analytics, robotics, and cognitive technologies such as Artificial Intelligence (AI). Our Strategy & Analytics portfolio helps clients leverage rigorous analytical capabilities and a pragmatic mindset to solve the most complex of problems. By joining our team, you will play a key role in helping to our clients uncover hidden relationships from vast troves of data and transforming the Government and Public Services marketplace. Work you'll do SFL Scientific, a Deloitte Business, is a U.S. based, data science consulting firm specializing in building mission-specific, artificial intelligence (AI) technologies. We are seeking an experienced embedded software engineer to help us design, build, and launch Artificial Intelligence applications and solutions on UAV platforms in mission critical environments. Providing advanced autonomous, real-time, AI-based solutions, we continuously strive to find the most innovative ways to deliver sophisticated inspection/detection applications on multiple UAV platforms. As the Embedded Engineer you will incorporate the latest embedded AI hardware and software solutions into our AI product line including NVIDIA SOC's, and XILINX FPGA's and ACAP's. Our AI products are targeted for a wide range of UAV platforms ranging from enterprise to government. You will be involved in all aspects of our technology stack, implementing state-of-the-art AI algorithms on powerful embedded SOC's. Comfortability with the latest real-time embedded architectures and best practices is crucial for the position. Professionals will serve as trusted advisors to our clients, working with them to make clear data-driven choices about where to play and how to win - ultimately driving growth and enterprise value. RESPONSIBILITIES Productionize real-time ubiquitous AI algorithms for inspection and detection in mission critical applications Implement real-time data pipeline streams for maximum throughput and diversity Design and implement real-time data storage solutions Optimize AI solutions for maximum effectiveness on various HW and SW platforms Ensure code quality via test-driven development Collaborate with external teams, vendors, and customers to maximize product usefulness and reliability. Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests Collaborate and communicate complex technical concepts The team Deloitte's Government and Public Services (GPS) practice - our people, ideas, technology and outcomes-is designed for impact. Serving federal, state, & local government clients as well as public higher education institutions, our team of over 15,000+ professionals brings fresh perspective to help clients anticipate disruption, reimagine the possible, and fulfill their mission promise. The GPS Analytics and Cognitive (A&C) offering is responsible for developing advanced analytics products and applying data visualization and statistical programming tools to enterprise data in order to advance and enable the key mission outcomes for our clients. Our team supports all phases of analytic work product development, from the identification of key business questions through data collection and ETL, and from performing analyses and using a wide range of statistical, machine learning, and applied mathematical techniques to delivery insights to decision-makers. Our practitioners give special attention to the interplay between data and the business processes that produce it and the decision-makers that consume insights. Qualifications Required: Master's degree required in Computer Science, Engineering or a related technical discipline 8+ years of software development experience in a technology company 3+ years experience developing embedded application on multiple HW/SW platforms Fluent in software fundamentals including software design and maintainability Proficient understanding of a real-time architecture implemented for maximum reliability and throughput Experience with the embedded microprocessor tools Proficient in C/C++ and Python programming language and common tools, i.e., NumPy, Pandas, etc. Proficient implementing interprocess communication using the IP stack Good understanding of software testing principles and test-driven development Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git Must be legally authorized to work in the United States without the need for employer sponsorship, now or at any time in the future Must be able to obtain and maintain the required clearance for this role Travel up to 5% Located in Kingston, RI Preferred: Basic knowledge of AI principles Past experience developing real-time embedded Drone applications Understanding of physics and basic principles #LI-MM4

title: Application Developer
description: JOB SUMMARY The Lead Applications Developer is responsible for creating and developing enterprise web-based software applications. Applies expert knowledge on application development technologies and technical trends. Works on projects of high complexity within one or more development environments and on multiple programs/systems/applications as a senior project team member. Additional responsibilities include leading development projects and delegating work to other team members. MAJOR DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES Actively and consistently supports all efforts to simplify and enhance the customer/client experience. Organizes and assigns work, project based, for members of the Application Development team. Designs, implements and delivers flawless web application for internal and external users. Shapes the direction of assigned project team(s) for project execution of application development. Builds and creates superb user experiences with engaging UI, rich data integration, and optimal performance. Contributes ideas to improve the team processes and best practices based on prior extensive experience. Works with the team to write new features and UI enhancements for existing web applications. Actively pursue knowledge of new development technologies in the areas of enterprise web applications, operational tools and other niches as necessary. Estimates work effort. Ensures that validated deliverables meet functional and design specifications and requirements. Performs thorough application reviews through unit testing and code-reviews. Executes automated tests during functional and regression test cycles. Documents problems and assists in their resolution. Identifies potential quality issues per defined process and immediately escalates potential quality issues to management. Interfaces with other project team members in resolving issues. Isolates, replicates, and reports defects and verifies defect fixes. Collaborates with technical staff to learn and understand software problems. Provides general system users and management with system analysis and feedback. Mentors and coaches less experienced staff. Analyzes and resolves automation related problems by coordinating with team to diagnose and fix issues. REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS Required Skills/Abilities and Knowledge Ability to read, write, speak and understand English Effective communication skills, both written and verbal Ability to focus on deadlines and deliverables Self-starter, self-motivated, driven individual Demonstrated in-depth skills in analyzing and resolving defects Ability to work well with shifting priorities Ability to work with cross-functional team of internal and external resources located onshore and offshore Thorough understanding of quality assurance process, tools and methodologies Proficient in Visual Studio developed applications Effective attention to detail Expert understanding of the AGILE software development life cycle Proficient in Microsoft Office applications (Word, Excel, Outlook, Visio, Access) Displays professional, positive, and approachable attitude/demeanor and discretion Demonstrated in-depth understanding of database schemas and querying tools Negotiation skills and ability to influence others by educating and sharing information Ability to assist others in learning new technical and professional capabilities Ability to accurately analyze automation opportunities for technical requirements and consider long-term business value Expert knowledge of React, Angular, C#, AJAX, JSON, HTML, XML and SQL technologies Knowledge of developing and consuming APIs and Web Services Required Education BA/BS in Information Technology, Computer Science, or related field or equivalent work experience Required Related Work Experience and Number of Years Relevant .NET web application development experience - 7+ PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS Preferred Education Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Engineering or related field Preferred Related Work Experience and Number of Years Developing Front end web application experience - 5 years JSON, REST, SOAP web services experience - 5 years Professional software development experience - 5 years WORKING CONDITIONS Office environment Travel may be required ISW390 2023-23104 2023 Here, employees don’t just have jobs, they build careers. That’s why we believe in offering a comprehensive pay and benefits package that rewards employees for their contributions to our success, supports all aspects of their well-being, and delivers real value at every stage of life. A qualified applicant’s criminal history, if any, will be considered in a manner consistent with applicable laws, including local ordinances. When you join us, you’re joining a strong community of more than 101,000 individuals working together to serve more than 32 million customers in 41 states and keep them connected to what matters most. Watch this video to learn more. Who You Are Matters Here We’re committed to growing a workforce that reflects our communities, and providing equal opportunities for employment and advancement. title: Business Systems Analyst
description: Job Title: Business Systems Analyst (Entry-Level) Location : Flex Role (After completion of onboarding and training) Company : Innovations Lighting About Us : Innovations Lighting is at the forefront of the lighting industry, consistently delivering top-tier products and services to our clientele. As we continue to expand and innovate, we are eager to bring onboard a dedicated Business Systems Analyst to spearhead the implementation of our new ERP system. Job Description : We are in search of an enthusiastic and detail-oriented Business Systems Analyst to play a crucial role in the implementation of our Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) system. This entry-level position offers the opportunity to collaborate with various departments, ensuring the ERP system is tailored to meet our business objectives, streamline processes, and facilitate informed decision-making. Key Responsibilities : Assist in the implementation, configuration, and integration of the ERP system across the organization. Work alongside senior team members to gather and analyze business requirements, ensuring they are accurately reflected in system functionalities. Maintain data integrity within the ERP system, adhering to best practices for data management. Participate in training sessions and workshops to enhance understanding and utilization of the ERP system. Monitor system performance, reporting any issues and suggesting areas for optimization. Stay updated on industry trends and emerging technologies in ERP systems to provide informed recommendations. Adhere to established ERP policies and procedures to ensure system reliability and compliance. Qualifications : Bachelor's degree in Business, Information Technology, or a related field. Familiarity with ERP systems, with a keen interest in further specialization. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal abilities. Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. Eagerness to learn and adapt to new technologies and processes. Benefits : Competitive salary with potential for performance-based bonuses. Comprehensive medical assistance plan 401K with a 4% match Paid time off and holidays Employee discounts Flexible work from home options available.

title: Software Architect
description: All offices are currently open, and our employees are back 4 or 5 days a week in Hudson Yards, NY and 3 days a week in all other offices. If you have questions on this policy or the application process, please contact recruiting@gafg.com. COMPANY OVERVIEW Global Atlantic Financial Group is a leader in the U.S. life insurance and annuity industry, serving the needs of individuals and institutions. Global Atlantic is a majority-owned subsidiary of KKR, a leading global investment firm that offers alternative asset management across multiple strategies and capital markets solutions. Global Atlantic is looking for a diverse team of talented individuals who reinforce our culture of collaboration and innovation. We are dedicated to the career development of our people because we know they are critical to our long-term success. Join our team and come grow with us. We use Greenhouse as our scheduling tool and communicate through their systems. At times, your email may block our communications. Please be sure to check your SPAM so that you do not miss critical information about our process, including scheduling. POSITION OVERVIEW As a member of the Shared Services Technology Systems team, within the IT department, the IT Shared Services Integration Developer is responsible for designing, developing, implementing, and supporting all data integrations between the various systems. as well as supporting the day-to-day operations of those integrations. This role requires a highly organized, detail-oriented individual who can work well under pressure and is comfortable in a fast-paced environment. The role must be able to effectively communicate with stakeholders at all levels of the organization and be able to work independently and as part of a team. The successful candidate will have a passion for technology and a strong desire to stay up to date with emerging trends and best practices in the Human Resource technology domain. KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: Design and develop data integrations between systems as needed. The primary focus will be on integration with SAP Employee Central and the downstream systems. Implement data mappings and transformations to ensure data consistency and accuracy across systems. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and understand requirements for data integration. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to data integration. Perform unit testing and assist with integration testing. Develop and maintain technical documentation for data integration. Participate in system upgrades and enhancements as required. Develop and maintain Powershell scripts to support movement of data. Stay up to date with SAP Success Factors and Employee Central best practices and new features. QUALIFICATIONS Bachelor's degree in computer science, Information Technology, or related field Minimum of 3 years of experience with integration technologies such as SAP Cloud Platform Integration, Dell Boomi, MuleSoft or other integration software 1+ year of experience writing Powershell scripts to manage data movement Proficient in SQL, XML, and other relevant programming languages Strong problem-solving and analytical skills Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team environment. Experience in SAP Success Factors and Employee Central data integrations or other HRIS platform integrations is a plus. Various jurisdictions have passed pay transparency laws that require companies provide salary ranges for any positions for which they are accepting applications. Global Atlantic has offices in Atlanta, Batesville, Bermuda, Boston, Des Moines, Hartford, Indianapolis, and New York City. The base salary range posted below is inclusive of the lowest cost of living geography to the highest in which we have a Global Atlantic office. Global Atlantic's base salary range is determined through an analysis of similar positions in the external labor market. Base pay is just one component of Global Atlantic's total compensation package for employees and at times we hire outside the boundaries of the salary range. Other rewards may include annual cash bonuses, long-term incentives (equity), generous benefits (including immediate vesting on employee contributions to a 401(k), as well as a company match on your contributions), and sales incentives. Actual compensation for all roles will be based upon geographic location, work experience, education, licensure requirements and/or skill level and will be finalized at the time of offer. Compensation for our more senior positions have a larger component of short-term cash bonus and long-term incentives. The base salary range for this role is $100,000 to $130,000. #LI-AO1 #LI-Hybrid TOTAL REWARDS STATEMENT Global Atlantic's total rewards package is reflective of our corporate values, particularly diversity, excellence and innovation, with a focus on inclusion, pay equity, and flexibility. We are proud to support your personal and professional growth and well-being through programs such as educational assistance, virtual physical therapy, remote/onsite fitness reimbursement, a medical second opinion program, pet insurance, military leave, parental leave, adoption assistance, fertility and family planning coverage. We strive to foster a culture of total well-being through community outreach and charitable giving programs. We are active in our communities- New York: Red Hook Conservancy, Girls Who Invest and The Bowery Mission Boston: Cradles to Crayons, Project Bread, Let's Get Ready, Rise Against Hunger, Salvation Army and many other local volunteer organizations in around the Boston area Hartford: Habitat for Humanity, Foodshare, Humane Society, Hands on Hartford, Mercy Shelter and Dog Star Rescue Indianapolis: Elevate Indianapolis, Gleaners Food Bank and the Juvenile Diabetes Research Foundation Batesville: American Cancer Society Relay for Life, Angels of Giving, Margaret Mary Health Foundation, Ripley County Community Foundation, Safe Passage, Batesville High School Sponsorships, local area youth sports and food pantries, as well as many others Des Moines: United Way, Central Iowa Shelter & Services, Junior Achievement of Central Iowa and Make a Wish Foundation Berwyn: Food drive and will be planning an event to help a local family over the holidays Atlanta: Packaged Good Organization, which helps the most vulnerable community members with providing personalized care packages for people in need including the elderly, our armed forces, the homeless and hospitalized kids Bermuda: Sponsor of a weekly feeding program operated by The Hamilton Seventh-Day Adventist Church Social platforms provide an environment to collaborate with others and participate in friendly competitions towards achieving physical, emotional and financial well-being. Our highly competitive health, retirement, life and disability plans can be tailored to best suit your needs and those of your whole family. Global Atlantic is committed to creating an inclusive environment where everyone can meaningfully contribute to our success. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and we do not discriminate in employment on any basis that is prohibited by federal, state or local laws. More than that, we strive to be inclusive of all backgrounds and experiences, which we feel gives us a competitive advantage in the market and within our firm. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age, or veteran status. Employees who require an accommodation to perform the essential functions of their job will participate in an interactive process which may include providing documentation. If you are hired and require an accommodation for any protected status, please email benefits@gafg.com. Please click on the below links to learn more about Global Atlantic.
